name: Alisha A.
text: The staff is awesome and the facility is well kept. Just love it!!!  Highly recommend.

name: Dr.David Callaway
text: Wonderful place,Very clean. Staff is very nice and helpful. The therapy is the best around.They look after all my needs.The food is really good as well. They treat there residents with respect, and honor.The rooms are nice too.

name: Mary Folsom
text: Such nice folks! I came here after my knee replacement and the therapy was top notch!

name: laura hough
text: I've worked at this facility for 2.5 years and have loved it the entire time. The staff is very friendly, ED is very accommodating, therapies are excellent. The only reason for my resignation is because my husband is now travelling for work and I need to be closer to home. Otherwise, I would work here until retirement. The nursing staff is wonderful and accomodating. The ED has been updating the building and it looks very nice. Zero odors, ever. The food is good and hot when delivered on halls as staff completes test trays often to ensure palatability. The Food and Nutrition Manager is always implementing new programs to make the residents feel at home -- ice cream socials, homemade bread to make the dining room smell good, omelet and waffle stations. Overall this is a great facility and I would absolutely place my family member here if needed.

name: Bill Werner
text: Both my mother and father have been at this facility over the course of several years after falls at home.  Nice staff and a wonderful therapy team.  Best in Mobile.

name: Susan Bell
text: I moved my Mother from another facility to this one and am very glad I did.  Staff have been very nice and while we did have to wait on a private room, she has one now and they have been very accomodating in making it home like for her.  She has transitioned very easily and has made herself some friends that she visits with.  My family and I have been very pleased.

name: Krystal Bean
text: My grandmother was a patient here and she got great care.  The admissions staff was really nice and understanding and the nursing and therapy staff was amazing.  My family felt good knowing she was being taken care of.

name: Julie Peyton
text: This facility came highly recommended and it did not disappoint.  My mother was admitted after her hip surgery and the therapy was excellent.  I don't typically write reviews but was truly impressed with the care she was given.

name: Shannon Harris
text: We had a terrible experience with the night nurses. My 88 year old father was there for rehab and when I arrived at 5 am, I found his nurse call button in the chair where he couldn’t reach it. They had wrestled it away from him injuring (cutting)his finger and bruising him. They said that he kept pushing the button. Totally unacceptable. When I left the night before at 9 pm, I left his cell phone along with a pad that had my number and my brothers written down on the tray table next to his bed. When I got there, both had been moved to a desk in his room that again he couldn’t reach. I would hire a sitter if your loved one is ever has to be in this facility, especially at night. Beware of the night nurses. I have names of them if needed.

name: Joseph Knight
text: Nice people.  My siblings and I researched the facilities here in Mobile and this one is the best.

name: Tom Steele
text: Would not recommend. Nursing care was disappointing. The therapy was ok. Try another place.

name: Wade Willis
text: My Mom was at this facility for 20 days following her hip replacement.  The therapy was really good, everyone was friendly and she didn't have to share a room which she wouldn't like.

name: Jamie MeMe
text: Absolutely terrible experience; some staff is amazing only a small portion while other staff is horrific and shouldn't be taking care of people or anyone for that matter. Had an issue and staff never followed through. Without going into full details, I wouldn't put my worst enemy in this place. People incarcerated are treated better!  And how absolutely slow the staff is for emergency every minute counts! This place should shut down bottom line.

name: Jasmine McMillian
text: One of the best facilities in town!!! the staff were so helpful and kind. when i walked into this facility everyone greeted me as if ive known them a lifetime. The facility smelled wonderful and everything was so nice and pleseant. also the food was AMAZING and the Therapy department couldnt be any better , I would Highly recommend this facility !!!

name: Mike Jacobson
text: DO NOT PUT A LOVED ONE IN THIS FACILITY!!!!! CARE OF RESIDENTS IS TERRIBLE.  STATE VIOLATIONS AGAINST THIS FACILITY FOR FOOD TEMPERATURE, RECURRENCE OF UTI's WAY ABOVE NORMAL; FINES ASSESSED AGAINST FACILITY. LOOKS GOOD FROM OUTSIDE BUT WHEN YOU GET TO ROOMS (UNLESS DIRECTOR THERE IS EXPECTING YOU) ARE FILTHY. RESIDENTS ARE NOT LOOKED AT FREQUENTLY BY AIDS/NURSES.  UNFRIENDLY STAFF.  CHECKED STATE WEBSITE FOR THIS FACILITY, LOOKS LIKE THERE ARE MANY WHO HAVE FILED A CLAIM OF NEGLECT AND ARE REQUESTING FACILITY TO BE SHUT DOWN.

name: Betty Lassiter
text: Great therapy staff, I enjoyed the food as well.  Overall a good experience after my hip replacement.

name: Joyce Scarbrough
text: My MIL had to be transferred from assisted living to a nursing home because she was having multiple falls, was declining daily, and needed skilled nursing care, so we chose this place. We told them from the beginning that we had gotten a 30-day notice from the assisted living facility to complete the transfer. Dedra, the admissions director, was never in when we called and never returned even ONE of my more than a dozen phone calls. When I went to the facility in person, she was never there and her assistant, Paula, acted as if she was bored to tears by everything I said and could not have cared less about our problems. Finally, when we were on day 24 of our 30 days and Dedra still had not done the face-to-face interview with my MIL to determine if they could take her, we gave up and chose another nursing home. I've known people who had relatives at Mobile Nursing and Rehab who were very happy with the nursing care, but the administration and admissions personnel are terrible. They made an already painful and stressful time for us even worse.

name: Amanda Eubanks
text: I work here in housekeeping and I love the environment and the co-workers I love the genuine hospitality we have here and I absolutely love how we all work together to access the need of our residents they are our top priority!

name: artgirl
text:
my husband mike was in mnr from mays 31st to june 18, 2018...for rehab...they put him at the end of a long hallway...i think it was room 327...i donot recommend this snf to anyone...on the first day after mike was admitted he ended up being unresponsive and em people took him to providence...we were there 8 hours and we came back...during that night mike couldnt breathe he was on oxygen...so i ran up to the nurses station and got the male nurse on duty...i think his name was vic...not sure...he came up...and checked his line and it had popped off the concentrator...because the line coming from the humidifer was too long...so he cut off a section of it and put it back on and mike could breath...vic...said this happens all the time...mike and i thought this is what might have happened to him and why he landed in the hospital...it is no telling when anyone checked on him...we had problems with some of the nurses espcecially a ms andry...she was so incompetent...i started coming in all the time because i was afraid something would happen to mike...there is a federal law stating that you can visit your loved one at anytime...they tried to keep me from doing it...but i talked to the administrator and she told me i could come in at any time...it got so bad that i started sleeping on the floor because i was scared...i did that for 3 nights until they said it was a fire hazard...so i started sleeping in my truck...and it was a good thing as when i came in the morning...mike was becoming unresponsive and sick...noone had checked on him in 6 hours...too lazy to make that long walk down there...i guess...so we ended up in mobile infirmary again... another thing that happens was that a psychiatrist named florin ghelmez came in while mike was on a bed pan and i asked him to come back...and when he came back mike was still on the pan...so we never saw him again...i guess it was to do an evaluation...so when mike went to mobile infirmary on june 18th by emergency vehicle i came to the hospital...went into mikes cubicle in er...and i saw a manila envelope...i asked mike what it was and he said it was from mobile nursing and rehab...i looked thru it and i asked a pa if they would copy the documents...she said she couldnt so i decided to just keep them...when i went thru it i found documentation by dr. florin ghelmex which basically was all a lie...slanderous...he said he had talked to us both....that mike was an opiate user...that he was doctor shopping and that i was his enabler...so it told mike about it and i later talked to an attorney about it...we decided to file medicare fraud case against this doctor...but would wait till we saw whether he filed the bill...we got the medicare documents and he did file for payment...so we called medicare and filed a fraud case against him...mike and i both thought that mnr was in cahoots with him because in the document he said he had talked to a nurse about us...my husband was on Percocet and fenynal patches but under a doctor care...dr Christopher nichols at the orthopedic group...and had been for a long time...mike was constantly in pain...
i just got a letter from Medicare stating they are investigating the case... i came out of this facility one night and this lady was sitting in the chairs out front...she asked me what i thought of mnr...i told her that this place scared me...that i thought my husband needed to be in the hospital where he could get skilled care...she told me that her 90 something-year-old mother was there...and that she was in a shared room but no one was there and told her that she could sleep in the bed...they never offered that to me...and i was there every day and i even slept on the floor 3 nights...and i told them i was sleeping in my truck...they made no accommodation for me...mike needed me to be there with him...and i was really helpful to those people...i would change his sheets and clean him up so they wouldnt have to do it...but i stood up for mike...i am not the type of person that will allowed being walked over...

name: Helen Shirey
text: I have volunteered here since 2003 I ,I love the people and the place . When it is my time I will live my final days at this place.

name: Mary Cooper
text: wonderful people

name: Angie Thames
text: The absolute worse facility I have EVER been in. I walked into the door after being let in of course by a employee that Never greeted me not even so much a smile, .  I understand the nurse to patient ratio is moderatly high but this is unaccetable .  I pressed the call light and timed the aids to address the light and it was 25 minutes before it was answered.  My mother was in a halo of rine and there were no supplies in the room, she is a tube feeder and the aid tried to put her head down all the way until I reminder her that she was a tube feeder and that wasnt suppose to happen, no gloves no barrier and the trash was over flowing, the TV was off and lights were off in the room, I'd not recommend this facility to anyone other than the state and that would be under the suggestion to shut them down, VERY POOR QUALITY OF CARE BEWARE!!!

name: Jasmine Young
text: Friendly residents and staff

fraud case against him...mike and i both thought that mnr was in cahoots with him because in the document he said he had talked to a nurse about us...my husband was on Percocet and fenynal patches but under a doctor care...dr Christopher nichols at the orthopedic group...and had been for a long time...mike was constantly in pain...
i just got a letter from Medicare stating they are investigating the case... i came out of this facility one night and this lady was sitting in the chairs out front...she asked me what i thought of mnr...i told her that this place scared me...that i thought my husband needed to be in the hospital where he could get skilled care...she told me that her 90 something-year-old mother was there...and that she was in a shared room but no one was there and told her that she could sleep in the bed...they never offered that to me...and i was there every day and i even slept on the floor 3 nights...and i told them i was sleeping in my truck...they made no accommodation for me...mike needed me to be there with him...and i was really helpful to those people...i would change his sheets and clean him up so they wouldnt have to do it...but i stood up for mike...i am not the type of person that will allowed being walked over...

name: Helen Shirey
text: I have volunteered here since 2003 I ,I love the people and the place . When it is my time I will live my final days at this place.

name: Mary Cooper
text: wonderful people

name: Angie Thames
text: The absolute worse facility I have EVER been in. I walked into the door after being let in of course by a employee that Never greeted me not even so much a smile, .  I understand the nurse to patient ratio is moderatly high but this is unaccetable .  I pressed the call light and timed the aids to address the light and it was 25 minutes before it was answered.  My mother was in a halo of rine and there were no supplies in the room, she is a tube feeder and the aid tried to put her head down all the way until I reminder her that she was a tube feeder and that wasnt suppose to happen, no gloves no barrier and the trash was over flowing, the TV was off and lights were off in the room, I'd not recommend this facility to anyone other than the state and that would be under the suggestion to shut them down, VERY POOR QUALITY OF CARE BEWARE!!!

name: Jasmine Young
text: Friendly residents and staff

name: kayla buttram
text: I was an employee at this facility and the way they treat some of the patients is sad they don't change them like they are suppose to they yell at the patients put their hands on them

name: Alisha A.
text: The staff is awesome and the facility is well kept. Just love it!!!  Highly recommend.

name: Dr.David Callaway
text: Wonderful place,Very clean. Staff is very nice and helpful. The therapy is the best around.They look after all my needs.The food is really good as well. They treat there residents with respect, and honor.The rooms are nice too.

name: Mary Folsom
text: Such nice folks! I came here after my knee replacement and the therapy was top notch!

name: laura hough
text: I've worked at this facility for 2.5 years and have loved it the entire time. The staff is very friendly, ED is very accommodating, therapies are excellent. The only reason for my resignation is because my husband is now travelling for work and I need to be closer to home. Otherwise, I would work here until retirement. The nursing staff is wonderful and accomodating. The ED has been updating the building and it looks very nice. Zero odors, ever. The food is good and hot when delivered on halls as staff completes test trays often to ensure palatability. The Food and Nutrition Manager is always implementing new programs to make the residents feel at home -- ice cream socials, homemade bread to make the dining room smell good, omelet and waffle stations. Overall this is a great facility and I would absolutely place my family member here if needed.

name: Bill Werner
text: Both my mother and father have been at this facility over the course of several years after falls at home.  Nice staff and a wonderful therapy team.  Best in Mobile.

name: Susan Bell
text: I moved my Mother from another facility to this one and am very glad I did.  Staff have been very nice and while we did have to wait on a private room, she has one now and they have been very accomodating in making it home like for her.  She has transitioned very easily and has made herself some friends that she visits with.  My family and I have been very pleased.

name: Krystal Bean
text: My grandmother was a patient here and she got great care.  The admissions staff was really nice and understanding and the nursing and therapy staff was amazing.  My family felt good knowing she was being taken care of.

name: Julie Peyton
text: This facility came highly recommended and it did not disappoint.  My mother was admitted after her hip surgery and the therapy was excellent.  I don't typically write reviews but was truly impressed with the care she was given.

name: Shannon Harris
text: We had a terrible experience with the night nurses. My 88 year old father was there for rehab and when I arrived at 5 am, I found his nurse call button in the chair where he couldn’t reach it. They had wrestled it away from him injuring (cutting)his finger and bruising him. They said that he kept pushing the button. Totally unacceptable. When I left the night before at 9 pm, I left his cell phone along with a pad that had my number and my brothers written down on the tray table next to his bed. When I got there, both had been moved to a desk in his room that again he couldn’t reach. I would hire a sitter if your loved one is ever has to be in this facility, especially at night. Beware of the night nurses. I have names of them if needed.

name: Joseph Knight
text: Nice people.  My siblings and I researched the facilities here in Mobile and this one is the best.

name: Tom Steele
text: Would not recommend. Nursing care was disappointing. The therapy was ok. Try another place.

name: Wade Willis
text: My Mom was at this facility for 20 days following her hip replacement.  The therapy was really good, everyone was friendly and she didn't have to share a room which she wouldn't like.

name: Jamie MeMe
text: Absolutely terrible experience; some staff is amazing only a small portion while other staff is horrific and shouldn't be taking care of people or anyone for that matter. Had an issue and staff never followed through. Without going into full details, I wouldn't put my worst enemy in this place. People incarcerated are treated better!  And how absolutely slow the staff is for emergency every minute counts! This place should shut down bottom line.

name: Jasmine McMillian
text: One of the best facilities in town!!! the staff were so helpful and kind. when i walked into this facility everyone greeted me as if ive known them a lifetime. The facility smelled wonderful and everything was so nice and pleseant. also the food was AMAZING and the Therapy department couldnt be any better , I would Highly recommend this facility !!!

name: Mike Jacobson
text: DO NOT PUT A LOVED ONE IN THIS FACILITY!!!!! CARE OF RESIDENTS IS TERRIBLE.  STATE VIOLATIONS AGAINST THIS FACILITY FOR FOOD TEMPERATURE, RECURRENCE OF UTI's WAY ABOVE NORMAL; FINES ASSESSED AGAINST FACILITY. LOOKS GOOD FROM OUTSIDE BUT WHEN YOU GET TO ROOMS (UNLESS DIRECTOR THERE IS EXPECTING YOU) ARE FILTHY. RESIDENTS ARE NOT LOOKED AT FREQUENTLY BY AIDS/NURSES.  UNFRIENDLY STAFF.  CHECKED STATE WEBSITE FOR THIS FACILITY, LOOKS LIKE THERE ARE MANY WHO HAVE FILED A CLAIM OF NEGLECT AND ARE REQUESTING FACILITY TO BE SHUT DOWN.

name: Betty Lassiter
text: Great therapy staff, I enjoyed the food as well.  Overall a good experience after my hip replacement.

name: Joyce Scarbrough
text: My MIL had to be transferred from assisted living to a nursing home because she was having multiple falls, was declining daily, and needed skilled nursing care, so we chose this place. We told them from the beginning that we had gotten a 30-day notice from the assisted living facility to complete the transfer. Dedra, the admissions director, was never in when we called and never returned even ONE of my more than a dozen phone calls. When I went to the facility in person, she was never there and her assistant, Paula, acted as if she was bored to tears by everything I said and could not have cared less about our problems. Finally, when we were on day 24 of our 30 days and Dedra still had not done the face-to-face interview with my MIL to determine if they could take her, we gave up and chose another nursing home. I've known people who had relatives at Mobile Nursing and Rehab who were very happy with the nursing care, but the administration and admissions personnel are terrible. They made an already painful and stressful time for us even worse.

name: Amanda Eubanks
text: I work here in housekeeping and I love the environment and the co-workers I love the genuine hospitality we have here and I absolutely love how we all work together to access the need of our residents they are our top priority!

name: artgirl
text:
my husband mike was in mnr from mays 31st to june 18, 2018...for rehab...they put him at the end of a long hallway...i think it was room 327...i donot recommend this snf to anyone...on the first day after mike was admitted he ended up being unresponsive and em people took him to providence...we were there 8 hours and we came back...during that night mike couldnt breathe he was on oxygen...so i ran up to the nurses station and got the male nurse on duty...i think his name was vic...not sure...he came up...and checked his line and it had popped off the concentrator...because the line coming from the humidifer was too long...so he cut off a section of it and put it back on and mike could breath...vic...said this happens all the time...mike and i thought this is what might have happened to him and why he landed in the hospital...it is no telling when anyone checked on him...we had problems with some of the nurses espcecially a ms andry...she was so incompetent...i started coming in all administrator and she told me i could come in at any time...it got so bad that i started sleeping on the floor because i was scared...i did that for 3 nights until they said it was a fire hazard...so i started sleeping in my truck...and it was a good thing as when i came in the morning...mike was becoming unresponsive and sick...noone had checked on him in 6 hours...too lazy to make that long walk text: Having to see my mom thru a window is heartbreaking due to CoVid19 but they are doing a wonderful job with their residents.

name: Misty Clift
text: Very clean, very friendly environment from the time you walk through the doors.

name: Suzanne Ray
text: My father was admitted one Tuesday for Rehab and I got a call on Friday morning that he was given another Patient’s medication ( 4 different meds). He was monitored at the ER and was discharged to home For home health PT. I was not going to give them another chance to harm him.

name: Susan Burgess
text:
My husband's cousin and Aunt are there. She is in the rehab just yesterday from the hospital after a bad fall. I saw a post from 2 weeks ago from an employee stating she loved her job and has been there for  4 years. Things have been good for  his cousin.
Praying his Aunt can recover.  All of our family appreciates the kindness that has been shown to out loved ones. It really means a lot.
Thank you so much! ❤️

Family appreciates

name: Emily Tinsley
text: Great place that provides great care!!

name: Tina Soper
text: I have worked there for 4 years and I love my job we treat each other like family even residents. I wouldn't work anywhere else.

name: Judy Brown
text: A cold day but pleasant experience

name: Carol-Ann Stewart
text:
Synergy Homecare was the perfect agency to support my dad’s stroke recovery. I needed a little extra help each weekday morning while my dad was on home health and his care giver (Brandon) really helped him gain his strength back.

Synergy was very responsive and very easy to work with, I highly recommend this company.

resp.text: Thank you Carol-Ann it was an honor to provide care for your dad.

name: Delaris Juitt
text: The office staff and caregiver are excellent Connie makes sure to provide the right caregiver to their patients.  Also counsel the caregiver on what the patients need.

resp.text: Thank you Ms. Juitt. We appreciate you!

name: Jan D
text: The caregivers we had were compassionate and loving. Helpful and caring. They took a load off our minds for sure. Synergy was easy to work with, as well. Thank you so much.

resp.text: Thank you Jan.

name: Tracey Sheets
text: I continue to be impressed by all the staff at Synergy Home Health. Especially Mrs Keisha. I feel like they really care about the patient and as my husband’s caregiver, I feel very supported by Synergy. Everyone has been so nice and helpful. I’m extremely grateful I connected with Synergy.

resp.text: Thank you Tracey for your kind words!

name: Aleshia Walker
text: Working for SYNERGY has been an extremely positive experience.  The whole organization truly cares about providing quality care and support to each client, and is in this business for all of the right reasons.  They are available 24/7 and work hard to accommodate their clients' scheduling needs.  The office staff truly cares for each client like family and we have wonderful caregivers.  I'm excited to see what the future holds for Synergy HomeCare!

resp.text: Thanks Aleshia, we are blesses to have you on our team.

name: Jenny Hallyburton
text: Synergy has great customer service and the management team has always been helpful. Scott and Lynn are always willing to meet families and answer any questions they may have. I highly recommend this sitter service.

resp.text: Thanks Jenny!

name: Amy Whittenburg
text: My mother is in late stage Alzheimer's and the caregivers have been wonderful with her.  They are very skilled and have the knowledge to deal with my mom on a daily basis.  They bathe, feed, keep her engaged and love on her.  Could not ask for a better company to take care of my mom.

resp.text: Thank you Amy!  We love working with your mom!

name: Lady Te
text:
I will not be with this company much longer due to low pay, plus I found a wonderful family that I will be working for with much better pay. I love what I do and plan on staying in this line of work but love doesn’t pay the bills or put food on the table and clothe my children. I loathe being forced to work overtime just to make ends meet which takes time away from my family. I really do wish things were different because I absolutely love the company and some of the management. I just wish they paid based on experience but they don’t. If you are experienced you will be making the same as someone who has never done this before and are afraid of the elderly. They really do there best to show appreciation for there caregivers and cna’s but trust me, the best thing to do is pay your experienced employees a decent livable wage.

You can bet that whenever you see “competitive wages” on the job application just know that means you will be paid little to nothing and a decent check depends on how desperate you are for the money and if you aren’t desperate enough to do a boat load of overtime then don’t waste your time.

I will say that Scott and Lynn are wonderful people and they are flexible with your shifts so you’ll be able to work what fits you best. Keisha, Kathleen and Santrece are so warm and wonderful to work with.

I’d say this job is great for beginners and students who plan on going into medical. Although we do not provide skilled nursing like a Ltcf it is the basics and allows you to get your feet wet. I love the company but I’ve outgrown it and just because it’s no longer a good fit for me, doesn’t mean I will not recommend this company to reliable people who need work. I’ve already sent some people Synergys’ way.

name: T0785
text: Thank you so much for your great care for our patients and staff at Arbor Springs!

resp.text: Thank you Taresa!

name: Nicole Gachett
text: Awesome staff and great welcoming atmosphere upon entry of the office.

resp.text: Thanks Nicole, you're awsome!

name: Dwayne Long
text: These are some truly amazing people who take  very good measures to insure that you are receiving the best possible care for what is going on and helps you understand all aspects of your care. And it helps that they have a great  attitude and outlook for helping people to understand.

resp.text: Thanks Dwayne!

name: Janine Rumker
text: Right from the very beginning, Shasta from Synergy made us feel welcome and cared for. She was patient and kind with my mother, who recently had a heart attack and had a stent put in. My mother is a caregiver, not used to accepting help and certainly a very proud and private person. She did NOT want any help, certainly not with bathing. Shasta knew just whom to send...Michelle. What a blessing! My mom went from not wanting any help, to wanting to take Michelle with her to her home in Florida! Michelle was so kind and understanding. She did things without being told, was efficient and sweet. I can't say enough good things about our first experience with home care. Thank you so much Synergy!

resp.text:
Janine,
Taking care of your mother was such a blessing. Michelle told us many times how much she enjoyed their time together. We wish the best for your mother in Florida and we will miss her.
Thank you again,
Shasta Kromer

name: venus9 Cotton
text: I have never work there but I heard some good thing's
