resp.text: Thanks, Urica!

name: Gretchen McKenzie
text: I have been working for synergy for two years and I love my job and they’re great people to work with.I give five stars to this awesome company!

resp.text: Thank you Gretchen!  We appreciate you so much!

name: Erin Carter
text: Great staff and so compassionate!

resp.text: Thanks Erin!

name: Santrice McClure
text: I start as a caregiver in 2015 when they first open up. I work in the field i absolutely love working for Synergy Home Care and the owners a very understand and i love working with them.

resp.text: You are an awesome caregiver.

name: Jeannie Davis
text: My aunt and I toured this facility and we were extremely impressed with it and the staff.  Mary Holley helped us and she could not have been nicer or more helpful. My aunt could not make up her mind at this time and they were more than understanding. They were kind, respectful ,and more than patient. If the time comes for her to live somewhere, I could not ask for a  better place.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your five-star review, Jeannie! We’re happy to hear that you had a great tour with your aunt and we very much appreciate your kind words about our community and its dedicated associates and care partners. We understand that it’s a difficult decision and that it’s one you need to take your time with. Please feel free to bring your aunt by for another visit soon. We’d love the opportunity to get to know you both better. Again, we thank you for taking the time to rate us. Please let us know if we can be of further service to you!

name: Debbie Wilson
text: Mary Holly came in on her day off to speak to us regarding Mom/mother in law. She was so very helpful, caring and sincere in her advise. The facility was so impressive, clean and staff was very  friendly. Everyone we met seemed to be part of one big loving family. All though we decided to bring our Mother home with us to Montana, we would have not hesitated to place her at Harbor Chase in Jasper, Al.  Thank you Mary and staff Alan & Debbie Wilson, Victor, Mt

resp.text: Thank you for your five-star review, Debbie! We’re very happy that you and your family had such a wonderful visit with us at HarborChase. We sincerely appreciate your kind words about our great community and clean environment. We especially thank you for singling out so many of our talented and dedicated associates. Every day, they strive to provide compassionate care that goes above and beyond all expectations. We truly do think of ourselves as one big, happy family. Again, we thank you for taking the time to review our community. Please let us know if we may be of service to you and your family in the future!

name: Kathy Dawson
text: My mom lives here & she loves it!😁

resp.text: Thank you so much for your wonderful five-star review! We look forward to serving your family for years to come!

name: Kathy Waddleton
text: Today I saw the disgusting excuse for food served to the residents. For the money that the residents are required to pay should at least bring a healthy edible meal 😢

name: Pam Ward
text:
Look on Face book and see what they are feeding residents...just awful.
.

name: Don Jackson
text: Where do I begin? During my father’s stay at this facility, he contracted Ecoli and was hospitalized  for two weeks.  Following his hospitalization, an employee of the facility (who claimed to have been looking out for my father) started texting and calling me.  She advised me that my father was receiving inadequate care, that another employee was abusive to patients and that the facility was unsanitary.  ECOLI IS TRANSMITTED IN UNSANITARY ENVIRONMENTS.   The employee then attempted to leverage me for money.  It was classic:  “I am going to look out for your father. He is not being treated well.  I need money..  Let me hold a few dollars.”  The employee actually sent text messages asking for money.  The Director of the facility was advised of the employee’s conduct.  When he was advised, he stated on a teleconference with almost ten witnesses that the employee attempted to leverage me because I was “successful” without accepting responsibility for the employee’s conduct.  Unsanitary environment, telephones that don’t work (even though you are charged for them),   etc.  Since the visitation restrictions were imposed 14 months ago, I am concerned that the quality of care has declined.

name: Just 1 Man
text: Beware of this place.  Your family member is not safe.  They sent my mother in law off campus for an MRI that she wasn't scheduled for and didn't have it documented until the next day and never informed any of her 8 children that they were doing so. If there wasn't so much covering up and lying it wouldn't have been so bad.  Generally I believe in accepting responsibility and moving on to a solution,  but when grown women are lying and pushing the blame, that means this type of thing happens often.   If it had been my mother.... it wouldn't have ended like that.

name: Esi Fante
text: If you can avoid it PLEASE DO NOT go to this place! TERRIBLE!!!

name: Vicki Scott
text: Hillview Terrace is Amazing! My mom loves being there and they are taking such good care of her. We started in Rehab Select and they were great! The Administrator, Business Office, and the Nursing Staff on Oak Station are so so wonderful. They always check on my mom and keep her room clean. They have fun activities for the residents. We couldn’t ask for a better group of people to take care of my mom .

name: Douglas Dunn
text: My uncle was placed here for 14 days after a broken hip.  The center used the COVID-19 pandemic to keep family members from checking on him.  He was left unattended because they said he had to be quarantined.  His surgical dressings were not changed during his stay here.  He was not bathed.  Now he has bedsores, open sores in his groin area, and his surgical sutures were infected.  This facility used COVID-19 as an excuse for neglect.   He is now in more pain and in worst shape than before he went into this facility.

name: Kendra Johnson
text:
This review is for Rehab Select!

The admission process was seamless and the staff was outstanding! Huge thanks to all of you for taking care of my grandmother after a traumatic experience. We greatly appreciate you guys and couldn’t thank you all enough! Would definitely recommend!

Honorable mentions to Ms. Awilda, Audreanna, and Nurse Paige! You guys were awesome!

resp.text: Thank you

name: James Archie
text: Admission process was seamless, way faster than the hospital, the staff was very nice and i was informed of her health condition every day

resp.text: Thank you for your review and i'm glad you had a great stay. We are always looking for ways to make processes work better. Let us know if we can ever be of any assistance.  Thank you again.

name: audrianna laprade
text: I had a great experience, great staff and great care, sometimes they took a few minutes to answer the call light but overall very good

resp.text: Thank you for your review and I’m glad you had a great experience. We will continue to strive to exceed our customers expectations.  Thank you again and if we can ever be of assistance please let me know.

name: Berenice Lopez
text: My loved one received the best care here, the staff is very friendly , and they have an amazing Rehab program!

name: Fred Burnett
text: The nurses were very helpful

name: wendee hughes
text: Very nice and very clean facility. Staff are knowledgable and caring with patients. Had an excellent experience here and would recommend to anyone needing a place for their loved one!

name: Peggy Terry
text:
When you gotta go you gotta go !!
This is Rehab select adjoined to Hillview terrace.
This staff here doesn't get in a hurry for anyone. The call button is useless . I experienced this myself not the patient. I'm going to find out a top person to talk to . This was on Sunday afternoon between two and three . Finally got a tech by going to the desk . Oh she came and then disappeared for another ten minutes before actually fixing the problem.
Don't bring your family member here.
Rehab Select

name: Awilda Fegans
text:
I would recommso please with her out come.
— Awilda Fegsns
end Hillview Terrace to all of my Friends and Family...

name: Patricia Carroll
text: If you can AVOID this place at all cost. It shouldn't even be open.

name: Lover Boy
text: I've never been to this place, but I've interacted with a few of the staff at my former job. Those particular ones were rude & had no basic manners. I guess because they wear blue scrubs & work in a clinic that they must think they're above you. One in particular I dealt with named "Marghert" had a very cold demeanor the whole time I was waiting on her, and of course, she didn't say thank you or anything when the transaction was over smh. I won't refer any of my loved ones to this place. If you care about your loved ones, then you wouldn't either.👎

name: Jennifer Dickey
text: This place is a joke. Giving them one star is too much. I honestly cannot believe this place is still open. My mother's care was ridiculous. They never gave her her meds when they were suppose to be given. They all acted like they hated their jobs. They looked and talked to my mom like she was disgusting. I got her the hell out of there and took her to the hospital so she could get real care and they were appalled by her treatment as well. They even tried to blackmail her when she said she wanted to leave (per her surgeon who did not agree with any of her care) and stated that she would be stuck with the bill because Medicare wouldn't pay. I called Medicare myself and they said that's not true. The whole place smells like urine and feces. The rehab lady was rude as hell as well. No one here is professional. I could go on and on but just thinking about this place disgusts me. IF YOU LOVE YOUR FAMILY MEMBER, DO NOT SEND THEM HERE!!!!!!!!!!!

name: Dixie Forever
text:
If your family member passes away at this facility, the administrator sends any funds in the patient account to Alabama Unclaimed Property rather than turning the funds over to the designated family contact.  You will never be able to recover the funds, as the administrator will not authorize Unclaimed Property to release the funds.  The administrator will dodge your phone calls and refuse to communicate with you.  They are ripping off patient accounts.

The nursing home is filthy, needs repainting and reeks of urine.  DO NOT send your family member here.

name: Ann Jac-Gor
text: My mother in law came for rehab from knee replacement surgery. She has dementia, diabetes and the knee surgery.  They along with the insurance company said that they know how to deal with patients with dementia. They complained to my husband that she couldn't respond to their commands and she just sat there...his response was I thought you had the capabilities to deal with dementia patients? The response was "we don't do miracles." Mom had TWO UTIs while there. The second time we came close to the room on Sunday to a foul smell.  I checked to see if she was wet. She was wet and the pad beneath her was wet as well. They sent a culture of urine to be tested on Monday; the result was that she had a Urinary Tract Infection (UTI). By Wednesday they were awaiting prescription orders for her treatment.  My mother in law was transferred from there to another facility the next Tuesday. The UTI was still not treated. The facility where we had her transferred handled the UTI immediately. Dementia gets worse when there is an infection or UTI. She's Diabetic: they told me that they don't have a diabetic diet there to give patients. Well, I asked them not to give her sugar, caffeine, and pork. Her sugar was as high as 300+. When she was home, 118 was the highest unless she cheated then 220. She never took insulin shots; she got them there because they sent it up high with the bad diet, then gave insulin to bring it back down. Diabetic patients are groggy or sleepy when their glucose is up. According to them, she doesn't respond to commands. DUH if her glucose is high and she has a UTI, what the heck do they expect? OH, they don't do miracles! I guess I was talking to a wall when instructions and requests were given!!

name: andrew cook
text: I visited a family member in this facility and couldn't have been happier. Great facility and staff members. I wouldn't mind staying here when I get older!

name: Misael Hacked my account Santos Hernandez
text:
You all need to hire more men because ladies are not strong enough to pick up them people.
And your parking lot is too dangerous. I see why people dont like to visit anyone there because the parking is so difficult you might hit someones car. Hope y'all change how you do things. Thanks

name: Karlito Sway
text: Its depressing as hell to be honest. Why tf would anyone wanna send their loved one to die here?

name: Julianne Hansen
text: Sadly, I visited this facility to see a friend's mother who is recovering from an injury.  She said she hadn't had a bath and that she hadn't been "changed" all day.  Yet I saw plenty of staff gathered around the desk chatting and joking.  When I visited the restroom, a cockroach ran across the floor of the stall I was in .  I am appalled at the conditions here and would not want a loved one of mine placed here.

name: Daniel Bonner
text: My medicine is 2 hrs late every morning. The nurses will argue about something as small as weather I had 1 or two drops in my eyes. Very immature and arrogant nursing staff.

name: lrs 0022
text: Love this facility! good and clean environment

resp.text: Thank you for visiting our location.

name: Lakendra Jones
text: The administrator was nice and very professional

name: Sam Cullen
text: Corn dogs for bypass patient and filthy condition. This place needs to be closed

name: Bridney09
text: Please do send your loved ones here. My grandmother had triple bypass surgery at the age of 85 and was sent there for one week to do rehab. And she was told to bath herself, she came home with an infected bed sore. I made several calls to the nurses station to speak with her and was always told they couldn’t take the phone to her and the room she was placed in did not have a working phone. My Uncle called and he was told by nurse they would call the phone company to inspect the phone to see why it was not working. Which was never done. This facility in prisons the elderly. Please avoid by all means.

resp.text:
Hello,

Capitol Hill Healthcare takes the overall health and wellbeing of our residents very seriously. Your feedback is important to us and we’d like to know more so we may address your concerns. We invite you to contact our administrator at 334-834-2920.

name: IFeedOnYourSalt 2EAZY
text: Terrible place bad with terrible staff that treat the the elderly badly. The food is extremely poor and the sanitation is badly with roaches near the air conditioning units and the beds.

resp.text: Hello, Capitol Hill Healthcare believes in providing dignified, quality healthcare and a safe environment for our residents. It seems you have concerns that we would like to know more about. In order to assist you, please contact our administrator at (334) 834-2920.

name: helen mize
text: After a stay in the hospital I needed to go to a rehab hospital until I was able to care for myself.  I feel extremely fortunate to have had the opportunity to go to Capital Hill Rehab Hospital.  Everyone from the Administrator to the nurses, physical therapist, kitchen and cleaning crew were very friendly and helpful. The facility was very clean and offers activities and open spaces where you can visit with family or just enjoy.  The ability to have family members join you for a meal was an added bonus in well being.  I have visited friends in other facilities and they do not compare to the quality of care and friendly atmosphere of Capital Hill. I would recommend Capital Hill to anyone needing additional care.

resp.text: Helen, thank you for your review. Your feedback is important to helping us continue to provide quality healthcare and a good customer service experience.

name: Mayra Atchley
text: My father is currently at Capitol Hill and he speaks Spanish. The staff have gone above and beyond to accommodate him with the language and cultural  differences. They are putting ideas together to make him Feel comfortable and are working on providing easy communication via flash cards. They have been attentive, caring and have communicated anything that may help him make the transition. They have provided love and understanding to me. Everybody from management to the CNA’s have been outstanding!  Thank you

resp.text: Mayra, thank you so much for your feedback. Hearing from the people we serve and their loved ones helps us continue to grow.

name: Jimmy Arrington
text: I have been a patient at Capitol Hill twice, my experience there was great. The staff was very welcoming, helpful, courteous and beyond reproach. Therapy services were very helpful and help me to regain my strength. I would recommend Capitol Hill Healthcare of Montgomery to anyone that need rehab services. Lisa Murry- Case Manager will be your extended family during your stay there, and will take care of any of your medical needs. She goes above any beyond to take care of your problems.

resp.text: Jimmy, thank you for your review. We appreciate that you have taken the time to tell us about your experience. Your input is vital to our continuous commitment to providing a quality care.

name: Jessica Kearley
text:
Horrible. Inattentive. Slow to respond  Lacking basic nursing skills. I will not take another family member there.

I did contact the Administrator, Michael Burnett in June 2019 right after the death of my family member. I met with him and two other staff administrators. I provided all details and my contact information and they were to look into the case and contact me once they found out what happened. I never heard back.

resp.text: Jessica, providing quality healthcare for our residents is important to us. It seems that you may have some concerns that we would like to learn more about. We invite you to contact our administrator at 334- 834-2920.

name: Heather Davis
text: I recently did my clinicals here and it was by far the best place I've been to. Me and my class toured a few facilities and Capital Hill has been the most organized, cleanest,and friendliest. All the residents look so happy and clean and well taken care of.  As soon as you walk in you feel welcomed by the staff. If anybody is considering a place to put a loved one or looking for work, this is the place to come.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Capitol Hill works to provide the best possible experience to our residents, families and visitors. We appreciate your review.

name: Nancy Nobles
text: The people and the care were top notch. We were very scared at first and everyone put us at easy. We had been in other rehabs and this is the one. THANK YOU!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We appreciate the feedback on your experience with Capitol Hill.

name: Justin Farris
text: Friendly front desk. PTs were excellent with my grandparents.  They were nice and helpful. They cared about them and made sure they improved.  The facilities were well-kept and  the bedrooms were clean.  They were able to fit in my grandmother for a salon appointment, which made her very happy. Overall, I was very impressed.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback.  We always strive to provide the best solutions and care for our residents.

name: Hevan Lunsford
text: My grandmother is a hospice patient and recently went for respite for a 5 day stay so my husband and I could have some rest.  We were so so nervous and so was she.  They put her in a nice room to herself which was great - she is a introvert.  She loves the food.  I felt very comfortable after a few days since she was so content.  She even told me the day before we were to bring her home she could stay a few more days if we wanted and would be happy to come back! This is saying a lot from a lady who hates leaving her house.  So thankful it was a good experience!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback.  We are so happy to help you and your loved ones.

name: sheafran89
text: As a healthcare professional trusting others with my family is hard and the burned that trust. My father has fallen 3 different times with major injuries and no remorse or ownership from their employees.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you and your loved one may have had a negative experience. The health and well-being of our residents is important to us. We would like to know more about your experience and concerns. Please stay in contact with us as we continue to look into this matter. Feel free to contact our administrator at 334-834-2920.

name: Laurie Davis
text: Wish I could give this place a negative star. If you love the person, DON'T leave them here!!! My dad was here for rehab and had an open wound on his foot and in three days the dressing never got changed!! When I transferred him to a different facility a serious infection had took hold. He almost lost toes over this!! The staff has no care for the people that stay here.   My dad told me they never came when he hit the call button. When I came to see him they were all socializing in the hallway.  My dad was seriously neglected, bordering on abuse.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you and your loved one may have had a negative experience. The health and well-being of our residents is our top priority. We are currently investigating your concerns. We invite you to stay in contact with us as we continue to look into this matter. Feel free to contact our administrator at 334-834-2920 if you have any further questions or concerns.

name: Ashley Austin
text: no star rating (they made me select a star). this place was the worst ever. I would not let my dog go and stay there. the nurses drugged up my mom. she was placed on a different floor and sat in her waste all day. she was wrapped up like a hotdog and wreaking with filth. no way. I moved my mom outta there quickly. I asked them to bathe her and they showed me where the shower was told me to help myself. I don't know how they are passing any inspection. food was great. but the care was lousy!!!!

resp.text: Your feedback is appreciated and we have reviewed your concern. We are sorry to hear about your experience and will use this opportunity to review our procedures.

name: Stephine Luckey
text: This place is pure Hell on Earth! Even the nurses there call it "Capitol Kill". Easy to see why. There are 2 nurses in the whole place that are professional enough to give true care. The meals there are inedible, they consistently run out of supplies. Most of the nursing staff & aides are hateful to your loved ones. I've been there when people were just ignored while literally crying in pain(well past the medication times). I've seen people admitted & no one even knew they were there, so they were getting no care at all. The administration there is a nightmare. Bring anything to their attn & they will flat out lie to you about handling the situation. We had one of the nurses there be so awful to our Mom that we reported her. Since then she's been even worse to our Mom & not only that, she's got other care staff to be nasty to her as well. If your loved one needs anything, the care there gets huffy & put out about it, so what they actually give is attitude & rough physical treatment... And for all this lousy treatment, expect to pay near $7000.00/mth for the privilege. The PT team there is their crowning glory. They were absolutely awesome & so helpful & we thank God for them. Past that... DON'T LEAVE ANYONE HERE!!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We take the health and well-being of our residents at Capitol Hill Healthcare very serious. We are sorry to hear that you and your loved one may have had a negative experience. We invite you to stay in contact with us as we continue our review. It is important for us to work with our residents and their loved ones to ensure the best possible quality of life. Feel free to contact our administrator at 334-834-2920 if you have any further questions or concerns.

name: mary1234k
text: My uncle has been living here for a few years now and ever since we have had a theft problem. It started out with someone taking his candy and drinks. Then it went to someone taking his wheelchair charger and now someone is going in his room while he is sleeping going in his bag that lays right next to him and taking his money. And all the directors can say is well we will investigate and call you in 2 days. Like WTH... I  will just be up there with the police and let them look into this situation. How about that Mr. Director

name: Susan Smith
text: Great care of my Aunt!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your feedback. It's an honor to be able to serve families like yours in our community and state.

name: Tiffany Thomas
text: Worked there for seven years wouldn't put my dog in the place and my dog died years ago. I worked with some of the best people you'll ever meet is why I stayed but management and head could care less about the residents or the little people who make the place go around. If I could give zero stars I would. No supplies ever how can you provide care with nothing to do it with! The building is old hot nasty and falling apart not sure how or why its still in business. This place is hell on earth.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that your experience as an employee was not satisfactory. We realize that our team members are an important part of taking care of our residents and they should be treated with respect. We appreciate your review. We will continue to build the strength and unity of our team and work to maintain the well-being of residents.

name: Phyllis Nicholson
text: Uncle Thomas is a patient there and has been treated so nice by all.

resp.text:
Phyllis,
Thank you so much for your review.

name: Gunnar Chambers
text: Moved our father from a nursing home out of state to Capital Hill because they had a contract with the VA. What a poor decision this was for us to have made. The quality of care is terrible. The care and concern of the floor staff is terrible as well. There were a few nurses that actually cared but most were too busy sitting on their fat behinds at the nurse's station talking and playing on the computer. Anytime you asked for something they acted like it was a huge bother and distraction. Could never get a return call from management, never received any updates to care or changes to medications. Communication was non-existent from staff. Things were regularly stolen out of our father's room, clothing and food gifts would disappear. Would not recommend this facility to anyone that cares about their loved one.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Your review is important to continually strengthening the quality of our care and service. We are sorry to hear about your experience and we are reviewing it. We understand that communication about the welfare of loved ones is important and we want to be as helpful as possible. Feel free to contact our administrator at 334-834-2920 if you have any further questions.

name: Billie D. Evans Jr
text: It's a nice well kept nursing home.

name: Auburn Brown
text: I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND THIS REHAB NURSING HOME!! THEY DO NOT HAVE THE PATIENT OR FAMILIES BEST INTEREST AT HEART!!! ESPECIALLY RHONDA!!! I WOULD STEER CLEAR OF HER!!! SHE IS NOT A GOOD REPRESENTATION OF THE FACILITY!!

name: Mia Frost
text: Thank you for helping my dad.

resp.text: You are most welcome! Thank you for your feedback.

name: BYRDIE Yeah
text: Staff member brittney was not very compassionate or concerned to meeting the possible needs of my mother and I.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Your review is important to continually strengthening the quality of our care and service. We always strive to provide dignified and comforting healthcare. We are sorry to hear about your experience and we are reviewing your concerns. Feel free to contact our administrator at 334-834-2920 if you have any further questions.

name: Delois Pickney
text: Cool

name: Gail pollard
text: I have been working there almost 4 years. Kim is very good to work for-compassionate, kind , firm, but will always treat you fair. My job makes me feel needed, wanted, appreciated! Love my fellow workers, because Kim hires good people

resp.text: Thank you Gail!  We love having you on our team!

name: Sharon Chandler
text: Friendly service, friendly office personal, all around great people. Couldn't ask for better.

resp.text: Thank you Sharon!

name: amber lewis
text: My grandmother was there for rehab. The staff was very attentive and caring. Social services was very helpful with setting up her aftercare needs. We will definitely use them again.

name: diane rigsby
text: My mom has been in the dementia unit for 6 months.  We could not be happier with the level of care she receives.  My mom loves the CNAs that care for her daily as well as the nursing staff. From the administrator, social worker, bookeeper to the janitorial staff are all friendly, helpful and responsive.  So keep up the good work.

name: peggy nelson
text:
I was admitted to Windsor House for a short term stay.Short term it was 3 days . I was put on the skilled nursing wing with bed ridden patient's. Would not move me as i could do for my self showed me NO respect.Wasnt given my meds had to eat in room food was cold .
Not very clean at all called family and left.Would not recommend to anyone.

name: Selma Sanchez
text: I wish I could give thia place negative stars! The smell of this place is something that can not be easily forgotten.My mom was there for 2 and a half days until I could transfer her and it felt like a month!!! I feel so bad for the residents of that place that have to stay there with no hope.The back of my mom' s bed was cover in mold!! Medicaid stop paying for this place! Save some people from this nightmare...

name: Denice Stisher-Howell
text: Husband was there temporarily and level of care was not satisfactory.  Personnel are not conscientious and seemed to be confused at times about what they were supposed to be doing.

name: Sylvia Salazar
text: This place is horrible it smells bad they don't  watch the patients everytime I go  the nurses are joking around in the hall do not recommended this place

name: Annabell Johnson
text: This place needs to be shut down! No care for their paitents at all!!

name: Charlotte M. Ellett (Charlaxy)
text: Nurse came in to see patient and yelled, "What the f--- you want?"

name: donna hughes
text: The staff at The Gardens of Waterford are so helpful and knowledgeable in helping with placement of senior adults. I highly recommend The Gardens of Waterford for anyone seeking placement for their loved one with dementia needing assisted living. It is An open and airy facility. Happy and bright.

name: Felicia Lamar
text: A great place missing everyone

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review, Felicia. We appreciate your supportive feedback!

name: Elizabeth Haupt-Johnson
text: Staff and residents’ families communicate well with each other which has created trusting relationships and a pleasant home for residents!❤️

name: Monica A.
text: The resident's at The Gardens of Waterford are well taken care of each and every single day. All residents are visually healthy and beautifully groomed. The management team upholds a very professional and responsible duty to each resident and employee. When working at The Gardens of Waterford you must have  purpose. All residents at The Gardens of Waterford have a special Dx: that takes love, patience,  and kindness. Each second, each minute,  and each hour takes time. If you're seeking employment  at The Gardens of Waterford make note you must have #Purpose and you must have patience every single day. I am grateful for my time spent at The Gardens of Waterford.  I've  learned so much about memory care.  My future plans as a Holistic Nurse Practitioner is to work closely with Doctors and Nurse Practitioners around the world that are trying to eradicate #Alzheimer's

name: Robin Rudder
text: Such a wonderful staff who provides a caring environment for our loved one.

resp.text: Robin, Thank you for the five star review.

name: Tina Whitaker
text:
Loving community
Clean
Management team is very responsive

resp.text: Thank you Tina for the 5-star review.

name: Lori J
text: One year ago this was the best of the best in Montgomery.  Today, it's a disaster.  Management change months ago and Manor House has gone so far down hill that we now, for our family member's safety, have to leave.  The head nurse has no compassion.  The director is unfit to run a community.  She asked us to give her a chance and we did, what choice did we have.  She has no regional support.  The corporate office makes a lot of unfulfilled promises.

resp.text: Lori, we take our reviews seriously and would like to discuss this further. Please call our toll-free Human Resources Hotline at 1-855-273-4397 for staff-related issues, or the Resident Relations Hotline at 1-855-881-2576. Thank you.

name: Tisha Dickson
text: Wonderful place for families to bring their love ones here...

name: Coretha Slayton
text: The Gardens of Waterford wonderful "at home" atmosphere let's the residents maintain their independence in a safe, friendly environment!

name: Christina Wyatt
text: Wonderful place! They take great care of their seniors. 😍

name: Diann Smith
text: Poor old people this place is hll on earth.

name: Georgia Patterson
text: Patients bedridden live here

resp.text: Georgia, thank you for the five star review!

name: Andrea Frachiseur
text: Big Springs is a great facility for short term  patients as well as long term care residents. The staff works hard to care for the residents and patients. The therapy team is top notch and works very hard to assist their short term patients to reach their goals of returning home. Another strength this facility has is assisting families with whether or not their loved one is ready to transition to the next level of care whether that be an assisted living facility, independent living, returning to their prior living arrangement, or if their level of care requires them to transition to long term care. The interdisciplinary team works hard to make sure the patients return to the safest environment with the most independence and best quality of life. The therapy team is also excellent in assisting their long term residents to attain and maintain their highest level of function so the patients remain as independent as possible for as long as possible. New management is now is place and are working hard to provide the very best care for every patient that enters this building.

name: Cynthia May
text: Big springs is a great place to be if you need rehab or long term care. It has an excellent therapy staff. The nursing team is very caring. There are many changes  taking place and it is getting even better. Its a great place to work and live or for a short rehab. The management team is amazing. They are always willing to listen.

name: Shirley Warren
text: The nurses and aides try very hard to keep patients happy and make sure their needs are met. The therapists are top notch! They do an excellent job to get patients where they need to be in order to return home. I am impressed by new administration and the changes that are taking place. It’s evident that they truly care about the patients.

name: Mary Quigley
text: The staff are very caring and attentive to resident needs.  Resident needs are top priority and come first.The Big Springs team has been extremely polite, helpful and make you feel like family.  Staff are treated very well with a solid staff appreciation program.They have great survey history with the state.  I would recommend this facility for your loved ones and a great place to work.

name: Darrell Ducote
text: You can clearly tell workers are doing reviews to bring up the ratings. Lol. Sad. This place is horrible. They get multiple lawsuits per year. Do not send your family here.

name: Megan Ducote
text: Do not put anybody here. I have a family member there recovering from Covid-19. They are perfectly able to use a bed pan with help. Not to mention, my family member is in their 50’s. The staff put my family member in an adult diaper and made them have a bowel movement in the diaper! Humiliated is not even the word! Laziness at its best! Unfortunately this is the only place insurance would pay for or they would not be there! And honestly I have know idea the condition of the building or who even works there, due to covid, I can not enter the building. I do know the outside is terrible. Please find somewhere better for your family meme we if possible.

name: Michele Sledge
text: I have worked here for 2 years. Since the day I walked in I felt I was at home. Thank you  DVCR. it is great working here.

name: Brian Erskine
text: Its a great place to work and a great place to take your loved one staff is warm and friendly.

name: Leann Richardson
text: We currently have a loved one in this facility. And we’ve just had a loved one pass away that was a resident here. We give the facility and staff a 5 star rating. All of the staff are friendly to us, keep us informed of things and seem to genuinely care about our loved one and his well-being.  I can see a big difference in his health (mentally and physically) since he has been in rehab. After the stroke they have worked with him and his speech is better and his mind is better. The nurses and staff are always upbeat, smiling and laughing while we visit. They seem to enjoy their jobs. Cleanliness is a 5 star rating and the hallways are brightly painted and welcoming.

name: Safari Starr
text: If I could give it negative  stars I would administer doesnt care about staff nor employees shes a blonde hair blue eyes devil that doesnt know how to put the care and safety  of staff and residents over the greed of money I wouldn't send my worst enemy here

name: Beth Daly
text: They really care about their residents.

name: Lindsey Sanderson
text: My grandmother fell at her home. She fractured her arm that required surgery. She also fractured her hip that need to heal in rehab. My grandmother was there less than a week. The facility left her unattended in a wheelchair and she fell again. This time she fractured her neck and lost movement in her right arm. The facility took no responsibility of their error in judgement nor showed any remorse. I have to remind the staff about her health needs and cleanliness on a regular basis. Medications were changed with consulting appropriate physicians or family members. Bandages are not changed regularly like required. The staff documents in patient's charts that things are being done when they are not. Management is poor. Some of the staff is unfriendly. Staff act unprofessional in the hallways. They talk loud and giggle in the halls while at work. The staff doesn't communicate with each other or the family members. If you need a rehab or nursing home for your loved one...DO NOT CHOOSE THIS ONE!!!

name: Jessica Cunningham
text: Staff for the most part is helpful. There are a few that could improve their people skills. The building itself is old and showing its age inside the faclity. They are lacking in modern furnishings and need a higher level of cleaning throughout the building. Spider webs in the sunroom windows,  saw a roach in my clients room and the windows,walls and seating look dirty, some of it is the aging of the facility the rest is due to not being cleaned thoroughly.

name: Erin Broom
text: Horrible facility! The building is dated and it looks as though nothing has been updated in years. I wouldn't leave a pet here, much less a family member. My family member has gotten bed sores,  laundry in their room piled up with the room smelling of urine, no one in the front to monitor people coming and going from the facility. If I could leave a review with no stars that is what it would truly be. With what it costs to stay in a nursing home you would expect so much more and certainly not abuse and neglect. For the Huntsville area I would look at other places. I would not ever recommend Diversicare of Big Springs. My family member lasted less than one year in this facility and died here. Horrible care!

name: Katina Rice
text: I have a love one there and feel horrible the way how she is being treated with lack of respect with her appearance.  The quality of care with the CNA that works there are terrible! Please do your research and ensure you choose widely.

name: It’s simply Kg
text: Diversicare of Big Springs is an excellent Skilled Nursing Facility that provides high quality healthcare.  They are currently a 4 star facility and it shows.  Stacey and Debbie are very helpful and can answer any questions you may have regarding caring for your loved one.

name: Elite Remodeling, LLC.
text: Diversicare of Big Springs is not the place for your loved ones to spend their recovery time or life period!!!! My father was admitted into the hospital and was eventually transferred to long term care. December 2018 to June 4th 2019 he resided there. In April my father had a surgery and required his bandages to be changed frequently to minimize his risk of infection...THAT DID NOT HAPPEN....THE TECHNICIANS COMPLETELY DROPPED THE BALL IN MY DAD'S CASE.... THEY WOULD IGNORE HIS REQUEST TO THE POINT HE HAD TO GET OUT OF HIS BED, ROLL DOWN THE HALLWAY TO DEMAND SOME TO CHANGE THEM. AS A RESULT OF THEIR NEGLECT, MY DAD NOW HAS A LIFE THREATENING INFECTION (MSRA WHICH IS NOW BEING UPGRADED TO SEPSIS AS I TYPE THIS REVIEW), ACCORDING TO THE DOCTOR, HE IS IN CRITICAL CONDITION, AND WILL BE IN THE HOSPITAL FOR AWHILE AS THEY FIGHT TO KILL THE INFECTION AND KEEP HIM ALIVE. DO NOT ALLOW YOUR LOVED ONES TO LIVE HERE! I AM PURSUING LEGAL LITIGATION AGAINST THIS PLACE. PLEASE DO NOT LET YOUR LOVED ONES LIVE HERE!!!! PRAY FOR MY FATHER PLEASE!!!

name: Robyn Parham
text: Congratulations to Team Big Springs on showing your dedication and hard work on a daily basis. Due to your excellence in upholding our Service Standars, we are now a Four Star facility.....Well earned and well deserved!!!!!!! Keep up the fantastic work!!!!!

name: ERICA GULLEY
text: This place is horrible!!! My grandmother gas been there for a little over a year and has been in and out of the hospital mainly because they are irresponsible!!! My mom visited a couple of weeks ago and alerted the nurses to the fact that my grandmother was unresponsive and seemed I'll. Nothing was done. She is now going on a week in the hospital due to a kidney stone that has apparently been there for MONTHS and pneumonia.  PLEASE DO NOT SEND YOUR LOVED ONES HERE!!!

name: Mag Prime
text: Some of these 5 star reviews are faked so here's a random 1 star to balance it back to where it should be.

name: Levi Grimes
text: The have the best staff ever the have the most helpful

name: Brianna Jones
text: Do not send your family here. My grandmother has been there for a few months and she has been in and out of the hospital because they aren't taking the proper precautions. They know she is a fall risk and yet, they don't seem to care. They have the right technology to prevent accidents from happening, but most of the nurses there are so ignorant that they won't use it.

name: John Franks
text: This place is the worst, con artist what they are, they tell you to sign something and you have no idea what it is until it's to late.

name: Helen Gillespie
text: Very caring staff!

name: Bobbi Tennyson
text: The staff is really the best part

name: Tacion Boco
text:
DONT COME HEREEE !!

If I could leave 0 stars I would. This place was terrible. My grandmother was sent here after having surgery and she ended up with so many bed sores that she’s now recovering from. This place set her back so far recovery wise. She almost died in here but luckily someone was observant enough to realize she was almost dead and called 911. She was transferred to ICU and we weren’t called. Her hair was matted to her head. There was blood in her catheter. A majority of the fluid in it was blood. The “head nurse” / supervisor of that wing was oblivious to anything and everything and showed no compassion when we expressed our concerns. All she had to say was “I didn’t see that” when it came to answering or “how did this / that happen” . They wouldn’t let us come in ever and visit . Even after the Mask mandate was lifted which is why we couldn’t see the extent of the poor care. The goofy looking individual “ in charge” with the bow tie was also ZERO help. Showed zero interest in our concern. When writing down my complaints he was literally pretending to write stuff down . Two ppl quit during the conversation me and him had while I was standing in the lobby. Do not I REPEAT DO NOT SEND NOBODY HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO BURY THEM

name: Shazell Cline
text: One of the best clinics in the area. Employees help a lot and strive to make a difference in the lives of patients. They make you feel like family.

name: Fuck Trump
text: PAYROLL: YOU DO NOT GET PAID ON TIME! The whole facility is UNORGANIZED. The staff is OK.  Far as sending a love one there to stay short or long term.  Is a HELL NO!!!  The stay complaining about the food.  It's just a lot! Red flags everywhere.  The only time they want to do everything by the book is when state comes.  Sad!

name: Diana Bohanon
text: Just took my great aunt to Shelby Ridge, I hated to have to leave her but the staff made me feel like i was doing the best thing for her.

name: Paul Atwater
text: You guys were great as long as I was there. Nine weeks of rehabbing and everyone was on top of everything. I  reccomend shelby ridge to anyone who spends time there.

name: Cory McDaniel
text: Very Friendly Atmosphere. Has a “Homey” feel to it!

name: Jasmine Broadnax
text: Nice facility to place family member for short term or long term care.

name: Tristan Rose
text: This is the most worst place I have ever been to the people and staff here do not help each other out much less care about the people that are there needing help after surgery! I know two different incidences for people that was there after surgery come out fine and then had some complications and let the nurses know and the nurses brushed it off as no big deal! NOW their dead thanks to Shelby Ridge Nursing Home!! I would not recommend any friends family members or not even an enemy to go to that place.

name: Melinda Nydegger
text: DO NOT recommend this facility at all! Horrible experience here. Had to call the local ombudsman multiple times to get anything done. When we tried to get our loved one out of this facility and transferred, they made it as difficult as possible. We ended up having to pay for a ambulance out of pocket just to get out! It is a shame and disgrace to treat our elderly that way. I've worked at many SNF and have never seen anything like this. Please don't take your loved one here.

name: Shannon Cook
text: Cannot say enough great things about the caregivers at this facility. They treat their patients and families like their own family. I would recommend anyone looking for short term rehab or long term care to visit Shelby Ridge!

name: Dawn Ledgez
text: Do not send your family members here. If they are not able to care for themselves, know that they will not be checked in attentively and at least every 2 hours as they should be, as state requires. This facility only does what it is supposed to when state comes to the building. Once state is gone, it’s back to CNAs hiding in rooms, nurses being very rude to the residents, CNAs and resident families.

resp.text: We would love to discuss your concerns that you have expressed at your convenience. You may contact the Administrator Roderick Watkins at 205-620-8500. We look forward to hearing from you soon. Thank you

name: April Tucker
text: The people that work here do not have a clue how to drive! They are constantly flying down the road. This is our neighborhood and there are children they could hit. One lady actually did cause a wreck with my neighbor. They try to fly around me while I’m pulling into my driveway. Multiple people have complained to management and were told that this would be stopped. Nothing has happened and they all continue to drive like crazy people down our road. One day they will seriously hurt someone. They cause so many problems every day and I’m sick of it!

name: Margaret Mosley
text: Horrible place...they feed you a bunch of lies about therapy. .did not give my son a bath for over a week and a half ...you literally hafta to stay on top of them. Horrible food ..expected son to eat ground up slop and feed himself .when he couldn't move his arms ...would die before going here or sending anyone here .staff very lazy. Please do not send loved ones here

name: N Williams
text: My brother was admitted to this hell hole against the family's will after leaving the Spain Spine Center at UAB. My brother was alert and in good spirits when he arrived there after spending 6 weeks at Spain; looked forward to getting back to work. He was dead within two weeks. Not a smoker or drinker nor did illegal drugs. No major medical conditions other than the surgery to his C spine for a fall; he was 48 years of age, and worked for the Federal Government. We are waiting the results of the autopsy. If you love your family member, do not send them to this facility. They are the worst!

name: Susie Kelley
text: EXCELLENT CARE!! My father had knee replacement surgery and did rehab at Shelby Ridge. His recovery time was remarkable and the staff were so thoughtful and caring.

name: Jim Galetsis
text:
Honestly I would give this place 3 stars except the Personal Care Assistants on 2nd shift were very unattentive all the time. The nurses on 2nd shift were constantly sitting at the nurses station giggles and joking around. Call lights were ignored at times when people needed help. I was made to sit in messy pants after an accident on 2 seperate occassions for over 3 hours due to a lack of a sense of urgency.

If it weren't for a chosen few (names withheld) I would've given this place 1 star.

name: Ashleigh Finn
text: Quality Care, friendly staff & excellent therapy. Driven to get patients out quickly  and safely back home!

name: Nicole Smith
text: If I could I would give them a -5 stars, they almost let my father slip into a diabetic coma because they are horrible at patient care. I would never send my worst enemy to this facility!!

name: Ellen Scalise
text: I was in there after 5 weeks in the hospital, and this the worst excuse for a rehab facility. It's primarily a nursing home with therapy. I arrived on Tuesday afternoon and therapy didn't start until Thursday. I requested transfer to another facility Thursday morning and the discharge person pussyfoot around for 4 hours before faxing my info to the next facility. The food is very unhealthy, a bunch of nasty fried foods. And as another person wrote, the Nighshift is horrible. My roommate would call out for someone because she couldn't see to use the call button and they would never reply. They definitely do not deserve the ONE star I gave, but you have to select one to write a review!

name: Justin Moorer
text: My mother has been in this facility since December 2016 and the staff has been awesome and wonderful.

name: cyhn santos
text: Terrible facilty. The nurses and CNAs don't take care of patients well. Don't send your family there.

name: SAL ROSSI
text:
I was there for 5 weeks.The therapy was able to take me from not being able to stand on my own to walking 90 feet with a walker.They taught me to care for myself and shape up my upper body.Lesley and Stephaney were the beautiful people I worked with.I think of them as family.They gave me another chance.
The nurses and CA's were great and made every effort to do a very difficult job.They do a lot of work with much undo criticism. I am very pleased with many people there Katina,Massamino,Shirley,Veronica,and many more.Thanks all,Sal Rossi

name: Cole Martin
text: My grandfather was admitted and his experience was PATHETIC! He said the night shift did not care about the patients. He described to me that he had to search for cups to pee in because the night shift would not bring him a urinal when he called several times. He ended up peeing himself and he pressed his button multiple times and they would tell him that they would be in there at 7 then 8 then 9. He said he starved at night and the night shift was more worried about there own social lives than the patients they are supposed to be taking care of. Very disappointed.

name: Sandy Byrd
text: You have to constantly stay on top of things especially hygiene and attitudes of some employees

name: Hillary Myers
text: Very clean place

name: Lashawn Williams
text: Staff (CNA) very rude not friendly at all i wouldn't send my pet there....

name: Samar Misra
text: Recently, as I was on a shift this past week with a nice gentleman at this facility, I was kind of shocked to see some staff near a kitchen area or in common area not masked up in addition to seeing residents dining together and being engaged in group activities unlike many other facilities especially during the pandemic now.  Despite being spoken to well and professionally by all staff, I figure would be good if precaution was taken where each resident would eat a meal in his or her room, group activities to be put on hold and all of the facility get covid tested regularly even if asymptomatic for best safety and comfort for all.  Wishing for the best while wanted to leave feedback.  Thanks!

resp.text: Hello Samar, thank you for sharing your feedback. We take all of our reviews seriously and we would like to discuss your experience further. Please reach out to us  at (256) 617-7285 with any further comments, concerns, or suggestions. We would love the opportunity to make things right, if given the chance!

name: Susan Fox
text: My mother loves this facility. The nurses and staff members are so very kind and caring. The food is great and the activities are fun, interesting and educational. She has had several personal health issues during her 15 month residency. Each and every time the nurses were quick to get her the help and care she needed. The residents are friendly and pleasant.  As I said, my mother has thoroughly enjoys this facility and calls it “home”.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your family’s experience at HarborChase, Susan. We are very happy that you and your loved ones chose our community for your mother. We sincerely appreciate the great compliments on our delicious food, fun Life Enrichment program, and dedicated associates and staff members. As a community, we work hard to create an environment where we could envision ourselves living one day. We’re glad your mother loves her home! Thanks again for taking the time to review us. We look forward to serving your family for years to come!

name: Nancy Bates
text: My family LOVES HarborChase! My mother has been a resident for 6 years, begining with a recovevry stay from a fall. She says it's the BEST decision she has ever made! She loves the personnel, the people give compassionate care, the comfort of having her own apartment, the dining room serves wonderful meals, and there is a wide variety of activities to keep her busy. Not only has HarborChase given her the opportunity to remain self-suffcient, but it has also given her more confidence in living alone. She's always been an independent woman and her spirit has soared since living there. I believe she has also given HarborChase new life as well. One can tell they adore her, too. She brings a smile to everyone's face whenever she walks into a room!  TY, HC

resp.text: Thank you very much, Nancy, for your wonderful recommendation and five-star review! We’re very happy that you and your family decided to choose HarborChase for your mother six years ago! She has become an important and much-loved and adored member of our community! We sincerely appreciate the kind words about our delicious dining services, comfortable apartments and wealth of activities available daily through our Life Enrichment program. We especially love the wonderful compliments for our kind and compassionate associates. Every day, they are focused on providing the very best in senior living. We’re thrilled that your mother has been able to hold onto her independent spirit at HarborChase! Again, we thank you for taking the time to post your amazing review. We look forward to serving you and your family for years to come!

name: David Kahalley
text: My mom was in another nursing facility that was destroyed in Hurricane Sally.  Lynwood took in all of their residents and in this crisis mode handled the transition very well.  The staff and director were directly involved and helpful.  We moved my mom two weeks later when we found a replacement facility and they assisted in helping us get her and her belongings together so we could move her.  Thanks to Lynwood and their staff and director for stepping up to the plate in our time of need.

name: Eboni and Rodney Jones
text: This place is horrible. My aunt was here for 3 months and only had 1 bath. She started to develop a sore under her breast. They also did not pay attention to her required diet restrictions. She was not able to eat pork and they brought her Ham Mac n cheese which caused her blood pressure to go up. I hope they shut this place down

name: Deborah Cooper
text: My Mother had been a patient there for five years. They are horrible. The latest administor Elizabeth her assistant Allison have managed to ruin off the majority of the good workers and kept those who are verbally and physically detrimental to the elderly. They  cannot be bothered with ensuring that proper maintenance is conducted, such as cleaning out the air conditioning vents or repairing broken doors. They simply don't care. Most recently I was unable to visit my Mom for over 10 days do to a out of town work assignment. I came back to find my Mother weezing and fighting for a breath. Her oxygen had been turned off at doomed point and she had pneumonia. Course I'd the nurses in charge of get care had stopped to speak to her they would have known immediately. To my knowledge there is only two good nurses left, Carolina and Michael. If you are thinking about placing your family member there, than don't. They may not survive their horrible care.

name: Tara Kamassai
text: Lynwood needs strong, trained, caring, ethical leaders in all areas.   Nursing care is “safe” on some wards ONLY.   Business office and administrative staff are completely untrained.  I would recommend finding a better option for your family.

name: Delora Pate
text: I had to place my sister at Lynwood in memory care.  The staff is very passionate and courteous.   I am very pleased with Lynwood.

name: James Dewberry
text: A simply pathetic place! The nurses have zero clue about patient care. They spend more time on Facebook then caring for patients. The staff is over worked and not paid properly. If someone sends you there run away as fast as you can!

name: L S
text: When my father was being discharged from Mobile Infirmary, I was given the task to find a suitable rehab/care facility.  I looked at 3, and choose Lynwood due to the location, and what appeared to be, a nice place.  My father was an invalid, who had a hard time feeding himself.  He also had a PEG tube, for feeding him when he wasn't getting the required nutrients/calories.  When he left there for another facility, during the assessment phase, I found out he had lost over 20 lbs in the 6 weeks he was there.  I lost my father 2 weeks after his transfer from Lynwood.  If my dad did not have the PEG tube, I could understand him losing that amount of weight. I do believe, that fast loss of weight, contributed to my fathers demise.  I also began to wonder, did the staff always seem to care so much, when visitors were there, or was it continual.  I do not recommend anyone take their loved one to a facility, where they aren't capable of providing a diet, that maintains their patients weight.

name: Linda Ploplys
text: My father was in 82w at this horrific place that I call an insane asylum. Please don't let your loved one go here if you can help it. The head nurses are the rudest, cold hearted people I've ever met. They have no soul left or heart. They let the patient's sit in dirty diapers, show them 0 kindness. My dad finally got in William F Green and they are awesome. I would rather my dad had been in Metro than this place. I'm filing a formal complaint. They need to be shut down. My dad lost 23 pounds in the 2 1/2 months he was there. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE PLACE!!!!

name: Jessica Evans
text: If you actually care about your family member, please go elsewhere.

name: Brandon Stallworth
text: My father was there for a couple months. While there he missed 5 doctors appointments.  Lynwood sent him to the hospital because his leg was infected. While he was in the hospital the staff "lost" all his belongings. So now my father has to replace all his clothes as well as worry about his health. Do not send anyone you love up there.

name: The Legion
text: If you have any love for your family member do not, I repeat DO NOT, let your loved one be sent here! We made the mistake of allowing the hospital to send our loved one here. Nurses and staff here are rude, make false promises, talk rudely to the residents, and are all around, untrained, unexperienced and most definitely,  UNPROFESSIONAL procrastinators!!! The service is about equal to using a public port-a-potty, covered in a alcoholic's puke at Fat Tuesday, during Mardi Gras.

name: Sawyer Guarisco
text: It’s great. good service

name: Cyndi Moore
text: Our mother was in the memory care unit, and everything from the beach murals on the walls, the layout of the unit including access to an outside area with gardens, to the staff was cheerful and resident focused.  The billing department is almost impossible to deal with, and the only reason they did not get 5 stars.

name: Ronkee Jenkins
text: Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88 Jenkins ronkeej88

name: Debra Fluker
text: Currently trying to recoup from auto accident. Receiving abusive care (or lack of) fro some employees. Reported incidents have been ignore. Confontations with both employees and their supervisors. Money stolen from my purse, and check sent through mail was deposited into without my knowledge or permission. If I had another place to go I wluld be out soon. Oh they get my disability check as well as my Medicare and Medicaid funds. Cant get help with personal things from some workers. They have been reported but they are still here.

name: Anthony Summerlin
text: One of the most dusty and uncaring facility I've ever worked.the ice machines has mole when it works.the wheelchairs are never cleaned.understaff always.and the meal choices are terrible.would not recommend to anyone's family.

name: Rayquelle Ruggs
text: Very nice people

name: Adrienne Pugh
text: Not the best place to send your family or work
