name: Tommie & Marry Carlisle
text: Excellent service and care was given to our love one. You all exemplified the "We Care" attitude and we will never forget how much attention to details and care you gave. May God continue to strengthen your health care facility as you care for those in need......!!!!!

name: Jawon Riley
text: Everyone was very nice treated my mom with remarkable care. Best people!!!

name: Jaime Mccullough
text: I do not recommend this facility to anyone!!!The facility smells like urine, they did have the proper supplies needed for my mom, I complained numerous of times and nothing changed, and they would half clean her and her room

name: Tracy King
text: Has to be the nastiest nursing home ive ever been in. Halls smell like urine and residents complain about not being clean. I would absolutely NOT recommend putting my family member in that place! Company wont spend money on the resident rooms and its easily noticeable by just walking down the halls. Theres a reason why their rating is so low! If you loved your family, take them somewhere else! It also depends on what color you are if you want a job there. Trust me you dont want a job with them either.

name: antonio Richardson
text: Very clean and  great service

resp.text: Thank you so much for your sweet comment!  We strive to make everyone feel at home!

name: April Mizell
text: Not recommended at all.

name: Randy Carpenter
text: Our mother is a resident at Summerford. She is always treated with respect and the staff have amazing patience with her. The facility is always very clean. Several staff members have helped our family tremendously. Kyla Blackwood has always helped to guide us through the complicated regulatory processes and answers any of our questions and if she doesn't know she finds someone to help us. Kayla and Aryn have been amazing in the care they have provided for our mother. They spend the extra time with her necessary to take care of her many needs. Thank you to Summerford for providing a safe and caring place for our Mom!

name: Lang Sims
text: One of the best things about Summerford Health and Rehab is its employees. To name one in particular, Kyla Blackwood is one of the most helpful, cheerful, thoughtful, and caring people I have ever known. She has guided me while trying to get things all set for my loved one, and she has done so with a can-do, happy to help attitude. She is wonderful!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words! We love hearing great things about our amazing employees.

name: Rachel S Fowler
text: Kari B is a knowledgeable in her field as an RN. She communicates well with her staff and patients. She gives excellent patient care and exceeds in follow-up care and routines. She is well respected by her peers and works diligently with her staff. She excels in the healthcare and rehab profession.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words 🙏🏻

name: Bebe Brown
text:
My mother was a resident at Summerford for 2 years and passed away this past December.  From the moment she arrived, she was treated with dignity and respect, she was well cared for and I could not have asked for more.  A special thanks to Kyla Blackwood, whose kindness and compassion (from admission until the end), made things easier and made us feel like family 💜
I have recommended Summerford to many friends, who have also had good experiences!

resp.text: We’re happy that you’re happy! Thank for leaving the kind note.

name: Stewart Walker
text: My mother has been at Summerford’s twice for rehabilitation. The service and the staff are awesome! Kyla Blackwood, in particular, has been amazing. She goes above and beyond to help the entire process go smooth and seamless. She is an invaluable asset no doubt!

name: Dettrina Peinhardt
text: Super good Nursing Home! Clean, Caring and Compassionate   Antionette Edge in Dietary always helpful and willing to do what she can to keep residents and their taste buds happy and healthy!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing. Keep up the great work Antionette!

name: Karen Walker
text:
My sister has been in Summerfords twice for rehab and is now a resident.  I feel secure that she is well cared for by the staff.  It is always difficult when you cannot continue living in your own home,  Summerfords has made that transition much easier.
Kyla Blackwood is very helpful with any questions or concerns I have.  She is a bright light in a stressful time.  Positive and cheerful all the time which is great for me and my sis.

name: Kyla Blackwood
text: I am an employee of Summerford, but I have had two family members there, my grandparents. My grandfather was there before I became an employee. The nurses and CNA’s are amazing. Lexi Powers, Jerome Orr, Rebecca Gay, Kista Burden, Michael Evans took amazing care of my grandfather. Cynthia Williams, Evita Williams, Cassandra Ward, Jessica Morrow took amazing care of my grandmother. This doesn’t include SO many others that have gone above and beyond for my family and me. I was on vacation when my grandmother began to decline. Charley Caudle went in and was with my Mom when I couldn’t be and I could never thank her enough for that. Our DON’s, Angie Chaney and Amy Lay are two of the most intelligent nurses I know. If we don’t know an answer, they sure do and are always willing to help  out where needed. Vicky Toller and Rita Evans in housekeeping have so much to do everyday and we are always adding to their list. They are blessing to the staff and residents. I am thankful to be a part of this team and I am even more thankful for the compassion the staff shows. ❤️

name: Spartan Tactical
text: My grandmother was recently admitted here after a stroke. she has lost her ability to speak and move one side of her body. she has a hard time swallowing or drinking. she's on her way back to ICU now because of the impotent staff and nurses who would rather sit at the nurses station on their phone than to make sure she is getting fluids and food. DO NOT PUT YOUR LOVED ONES HERE! Was all good during intake and then the communication wall went up. now they act as if they couldn't care less about my grandmothers help. I will be filing a formal complaint with HR and the BBB. Disgraceful.

name: Crystal Clay
text: Admission of my father to Summerford was easy, smooth and the staff was very friendly and helpful but towards the end of my fathers stay, I become very disappointed with how the office staff and clinical staff handled my fathers situation. He developed behavior problems and was basically shoved out the door. There was communication failure between office and clinical staff and in the end, my father ended up with no where to go and Summerford showed no concern because they did not want to deal with his behavior. I would not recommend this facility because in our time of need, Summerford failed us.

name: Blackkat RavenWolfe Productions
text: If the beautiful flowers and trees aren't enough there are animals you can feed on the south end. There are deers, goats, llamas, emus, geese, and turkeys just to name a few.  The rehab department is top notch and meals are usually very good.

name: Deloria White
text: My father has been in Summerford Nursing Home for several years . He has Parkinson's disease & dementia which are terrible disease to work with. His care takers Jerome & Lexie are such troopers !!! My daddy loves them & his face lights up when he sees their sweet face :)  Summerford Nursing Home is squeaky clean ...always !!! The cleanest nursing home you will find ...spotlessly clean. Everyone does their job and the staff and owner are friendly and willing to help any way they can. And did I mention the good southern homemade meals ??? Folks come from the outside to eat lunch /dinner here . The administration clerk and social worker is beautiful ...inside and out and knows her job plus willing to go the extra to help anyone she can. If you are looking for a home for your loved one.....check out Summerford Nursing Home in Falkville, AL.

name: Micheal W. Palmer
text: My father is here. The staff are wonderful to him. The location is attractive and always clean. When I get to be his age, I hope I get such good care.

name: Marvin Nuby
text: I visit folks at Summerford Nursing Home on a regularly, staff are very helpful and concerned about the care of residents. If I had a loved one that needed care, this is the place I would chose for them.  They watch out for them, if an emergency occurs, they take care of it ASAP. I visit there every weekend.  Not just one person, several folks I see and hand out church bulletins from GOD's Church that I am a member of.

name: Selma Sanchez
text: My mom was there for a while and I could not aske for a better place , a cleaner place , better staff.This is a place of mercy and compassion.God bless them..

name: Doug Oden
text: Very clean and organized very friendly and helpful staff.Great food

name: Kay Campbell
text: My husband's folks are here now. Staff seem attentive, & their room is a good size.

name: David P. Olivier (1000 Hearts)
text:
On April 11, 2020 I lost my Mother at this “facility”.  Despite CDC and ADPH guidelines which include provisions for “life and death ” situations; 2 men-yes, just 2 men- have put a policy in place that saw my beloved Mother leave this world and enter the next completely alone!  No husband of 66 years holding her hand.  No children or grandchildren at her bedside.  We were in the parking lot being
condescended to.  We were being offered a “glance through a window” moments before being told, in a parking lot, that she was gone.  If the roles had been reversed and any human being had tried to stop my Mother from being at the side of her loved ones as The final breath were drawn: No Earthbound force could  have stopped the Power of Love that coursed through that remarkable woman.  She would have been at my side.  I am a weaker soul than she.  I tried diplomacy.  My cries fell on ears so consumed with ego and a sense of power that the only meaningful response from the tyrant who dared only speak with me via speakerphone was  “...that’s how we’re doing it.  That’s off our best judgement.”
I posted a video on social media prior to Mother’s passing, after the phone conversation, asking for support from friends and others in the community.  The calls that they place were met with hostility, rudeness, and empty promises of “the administrator will get back in touch with you”.  As those phone calls were coming in and my sister was being told of Momma’s passing, I was receiving cold, disdainful stares by the only staff member who could even bring herself to look in my direction.
There is no way this injustice can be reversed.  This beautiful creature whose pastor said in his eulogy “... was a beautiful soul.  It was my privilege to be her pastor and to be her friend.  I'm not sure that I've ever known anyone who had so much love, so concentrated, deep within her being.  Every interaction I've ever had with Carolyn was permeated with love.” This giant of a giver.  This Child if God.  My Mother.  I cannot change the final moments of her life.  I can, however, see that her story is told.  I can see that these individuals who slither through this life generating pain and sorrow need not be concerned if they are alone.  I couldn’t be there for Momma on that day but with God as my witness, until I draw my last breath, I will live as a reminder to those who tried to diminish her that She lives in me.  Where her eyes are now closed, mine are now open.  My eyes are wide and inquisitive.  My eyes seek only one sight today.  That sight is justice!

name: Elizabeth Hollingsworth
text: Fantastic facility! The therapy staff are truly dedicated to helping you achieve your goals and get home as quickly as possible. The environment is bright and clean. Highly recommend this facility to anyone!

name: Matt's Regional Calendar
text: Staff was very friendly. Facility was very clean.  Therapist were great and treating us like family.

name: Charmin Mccurdy
text: My aunt was in this facility and recently passed due to severe dehydration and blood sugar at 700. She was not taken care of by most of the staff only family that stayed with her. When the family would turn the light on for help it would take up to 45 min for the staff to respond. The staff was /is overworked sometimes working 16 hour days. This is by law unacceptable. I would not recommend this facility to anyone that cares for their loved one.

name: Movin' Mark
text: Great facilities have done really well with my mom.

name: Barry lkard
text: Yes

name: Deborah Saye
text:
Worked here for over 20 years. Although, I am
No longer here, Marshall Manor will always hold a special place in my heart. They have the most loving staff that cares for the residents. I would highly recommend this facility if you are in need of placement for a family member.

name: Isaac P
text: There is no finer nursing home in the state! The love and care they provide their residents is unmatched. The staff are very dedicated.

name: Amanda
text: Marshall Manor is a wonderful facility full of people who were called to serve. They really pour their heart into their residents. They offer wonderful activities and social opportunities. I can't express how wonderful this facility is. They provide the upmost care to all their residents.

name: otto wood
text: Serving as a Hospice Chaplain for the last 3.5 years I  frequent many facilities through out the North Alabama region. Marshall Manor is one of the finest. They have a caring committed staff from the administrator (Linda) ,nurses, to the kind aides. The facility is kept clean and so are the patients. Most importantly the residents are valued and loved  and that is demonstrated every day.

name: Autumn Martin
text: Not working there anymore but by far the best job I have EVER had. I loved the people I worked with and my residents. Only problem I ever had there was some of the people there did not care AT ALL about their job or residents. We all had our bad days but definitely loved my job. Amazing place to work. I loved it!

name: David Denham
text: I would advise avoiding this place at all costs. My grandmother was admitted to Marshall Manor for rehab. Shortly afterward we found out she had lung cancer that had moved into her bones also. They consistently served food that was horrible, and in some cases unidentifiable. She was bed bound and had to push the nurse call button for assistance to use the bathroom. Once it was an HOUR before anyone came to help her. Finally, when we were trying to coordinate transportation for her appointment at the cancer care center, they were absolutely unwilling to help until I enlisted the help of the ombudsmen and threatened to file a complaint with their corporate office. They went so far as to lie to the scheduler from the Cancer Care Center when she called herself to try to arrange transportation. They claimed my grandmother was "very mobile". She was totally bed bound. When the Dr and the Cancer Care Center saw my grandmother, he apologized profusely and said he had been misled about her condition. He had her admitted immediately to Shepherd's Cove (a hospice facility). I regret immensely that my grandmother had to spend two of her final weeks at this horrible facility.

name: Doug Tucker
text: Avoid at all costs

name: Vickie Thompson
text: I use to volunteer here. Its in a quiet community. They do have a lot of activities for their patients.

name: Christapher Flowers
text: im wondering if hiring ? im looking for a job , and i want to work badly , i just moved to alabama recently i thought this would be a good place to start hopefully Marshall Manor Nursing Home can get back to me

name: Melissa B
text:
One of the worst as the other reviewer has said. Avoid.
The Director of Nursing is a total wack job psychopath. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

name: lucretia Lemley
text: Awful place to work

name: Eric Stark
text:
.. is a great place to be from, as in as far as one can get away from.
I literally had to sleep with one eye facing the door to assure my belongings were still in tact the following day. I lived enduring this ‘real fear’ the entire 20 mo. rehab stay loosing approximately $27,000 in real property value.
A local Elder Law Attorney stated if I had a rock solid case though if I moved the n it that Their Doors would be Administratively Barred (closed down), again, which would hurt a lot of Folks less Fortunately.

name: Erin Lovett
text: I would give zero stars if possible. My dad's mental status started to seriously decline while here. He came for rehab for 20 days. PA and staff kept saying that's just how he will probably be (in regards to his mental status). Well I know my dad and even though he is elderly he is sharp. He had a Foley and the urine was a strange tea like color. They said no big deal. I had to request they run labs on the urine (the PA didn't even want to do that). When they came back one of the labs was a little elevated, they said it was no problem, nothing serious. He wasnt eating well when usually he is a good eater. He vomited. He had hallucinations. He was lethargic. We reported all of this. THEY DID NOTHING. When dad's eyes started rolling back in his head and he was difficult to wake we demanded he be taken to the ER. HE WAS SEPTIC. The ER nurse's words were "What the hell are they doing over there? Your dad is very, very sick." If he wouldn't have had family there every day for several hours a day they would have let him lay there and DIE. If you love someone do not send them here. If you don't like someone don't send them here. No one deserves unskilled, uncaring, incompetent staff at a place where you come to get better.

name: Mack Hays Jr.
text: Wish I could give -5 stars. On Christmas Eve 2019' Jerelyn Tiller CRNP diagnosed my dad with a UTI when in fact his foley was blocked. When we asked the RN on duty (Teresa) why he was almost unresponsive she replied "he been up all day' he just tired." Dad suffered horribly & almost died from sepsis. if we hadn't insisted he be taken to the ER he probably wouldn't have made it another 24hrs.

name: michael allison
text: The care seems to be ok,we are experiencing clothes coming up missing, new cloths hanging in her closet, never worn, just gone, and of course no one knows anything. Buy some light weight chain and a small lock and lock up the closet and drawers, give your loved one the key put it on a string and have them wear it around their neck,then they will control who goes in and out of their  clothing closet and drawers.

name: Taylor Daniel
text: They did not take care of my grandmother properly and failed to tell us of several incidents that occurred during her short stay. I would give this place negative stars if I could.

name: Joseph Watkins
text: This place very clean and nice vauble care for love ones check them out 1 for patient care.

name: T Whitfield
text: Do Not Send Your Love One Here! My mom has dementia and had hip surgery and was there to help her walk again. When we brought her home we realized they didn't change her (diapers) like they should and she was SEVERELY raw on her bottom. She had bruises all over her where they (I assume) tried to pick her up or change her. So if your love one isn't able to communicate like they should or has any dementia DO NOT SEND them here. They do not know how to handle them or won't. Believe me Mom is worse now than before she went there.

name: LaSandra McKinzie
text: This is the worst nursing home for someone who had a stroke. My mother is inpatient their and they missed a lot of opportunities to get her better. First they told me she was ok after I insist that they have her checked by a nurse because I realize she wasn't mobile, weak, active, slurred speech, confused, forgetful and lost of appetite. I finally ask for them to check her for a UTI and after 6 days they finally agreed to have her checked. I was told that they had lab work done and it was negative. After not getting anywhere with the Nurse Manager, nurse, and CNA. I took my mother to ED to finally get a urinalysis that she in fact had a UTI. They are very unprofessional, liar, and uncaring. Don't take your love ones there unless you can stay with them 24 hours a day.

name: Robert Ricks
text: Night shifts nurses rude and unprofessional.  One came out front door to smoke as we're unloading pt. Could hear her complaining about receiving said pt then left us outside in the cold while our dispatcher had to call them to let us in

name: Sheryl Williams
text: If they had a 0 to rate. I'd give this place a NEGATIVE 5. DUMB NURSES, UNCARING CNA, SMELLS LIKE A DUMP SITE,ANS MANAGEMENT. WELL, LET'S JUST SAY my dog can run this building

name: Thomas S
text: Disgusting place. Horrible staff. Totally indifferent to patients needs. Do not send your dog to this place even if you do not like it.

name: Gail Cator
text: My experiences as a member of the Activities staff are endlessly fulfilling. For over three years I have been privileged to work closely with our residents, listening, sharing, laughing, singing, and so much more. Each resident is a precious miracle. I am honored to know them and learn their daily stories.

name: Debra Crutchfield
text: I have had the experience of having my Mother In Law and my Aunt at Birmingham East. The compassion and care that the facility staff showed was exceptional. The building was clean and well keep. Therapy was exceptional. I would highly recommend Birmingham East to anyone looking for a great long term care facility.

name: Sheila Bennett
text: I highly recommend Birmingham Nursing and Rehabilitation East with your family's long term needs. My Mother was there for almost 5 years,  the staff took very good care of her, all departments were very helpful and friendly.

name: Lisa Seabolt
text: I have been employeed at Birmingham Nursing for almost 30 years . Birmingham Nursing is a exceptionally nice place to work. We have wonderful nurses, CNA's, great therapy department , dietary and we have lots of fun and activities with our very sweet and kind activities department. We have great dining experience with staff there to assist. We love our residents here and treat them with the upmost respect the residents here are our family too. Just stop by meet our caring and dedicated staff and see our clean building. I am proud to say I work here and have been for almost 30 years. If my mother had to have placement it would be a honor for me to place her at Birmingham Nursing and Rehab East.

name: Susan Wnorowski
text:
Very nice here I was very happy with my stay here.I came here because my legs were weak, and therapy got me strong enough to go back home. Staff was very friendly and compassionate staff.
Carl Ford

name: Kayla Barlett
text: I've worked at this facility for over 7 years! I enjoy my job, and love the opportunity to provide care for our residents!

name: Karon Huguley
text: My sister has been a resident at this facility for several years. The staff has always been very professional and informative. The facility is very clean and very well kept. I would highly recommend bringing any loved one to visit or live at Birmingham East Nursing and Rehab.

name: Marsha Daugherty
text: My sister was a resident at Bham East Rehab & NH for 2 years.  She received very good care from nursing staff.  Office staff was great as well, and helped with making her private room more than a room but her home.  I am so thankful for the love, support and care she received.

name: Carl Ford
text: Not happy with business office and administration. They kept me 5 days over. Gave misleading information about my covid vaccines and changed my insurance without my consent

name: Jessica Amerson
text: Horrible place! Don’t send your loved ones here!!

name: V Gidley
text: I am so appreciative of the staff that take care of my mother.

name: Evelyn Stubbs
text: A wonderful place and a loving staff

name: Joshua Perdue
text: A great nursing faculty with awesome staff! The staff are friendly and offer each resident individualized care in a special way. The staff are also more than willing to answer any questions and/or concerns. This facility provides 5 Star Care to all that they serve, and they also ensure that the resident’s families are knowledgeable about all of the things going on!

name: Janet L Hunter
text:
My Husband had been resident there over 3 years. This had been the rudest business office people at this facility . Susan Wnorowski  had misappropriated my husband's money and now trying to punish me with her rude tone and bad Business  behavior. Tracy Yopasa is her manager she told me to just overlook Susan ways.  She Blatant lied and her Boss is okay with it.
I gotta say There all rude and unprofessional. Still unresolved issues on my husband's money 9/11/20. Still NO Word on my husband's stimulus check or other missing monies.

name: Robin Layfield
text: Under staffed. Room bells are always going off with no response, from multiple desk. Alternate meals are a joke.

name: Rachale Harris
text: Worked for this company 3 months.  From day one I wasn't given any training in regard to the computer systems or patient care. They gave me a set of keys and said handle it. Handle it meaning  45 long term patients. After I turned my notice in they cut my pay cut my hours back. The day I was supposed to receive my last paycheck I find out someone over payroll deposited it onto a H&R BLock debit card that belongs to someone else. I contacted the company who refused to correct their mistake.

name: Melody Crutchfield
text: My Mother has been a resident there for 4 years. CNAs and Nurses does a great job. Remember anyone can post here even those who wants to be vindictive torwards the facility because they are being ugly. Please go by the facility take a tour unannounced talk  with  staff. We are fortunate to have the honor to work in their home.I am blessed to be a part of that.

name: Erin Kinnaird
text:
My grandmother has bed sores because the staff are not turning her properly.  She has a UTI because they are not cleaning her properly.  The administrative staff always seem to be "out to lunch" whenever my mother calls them to discuss my grandmother's care (or lack thereof).  The in-house doctor won't allow my grandmother to have the anti-anxiety medicine that she's been on for the last 10 years or so and even though she's been diagnosed with PTSD as a result of a near fatal car wreck, he won't give her anything for that either.

9-24-13 Update: My grandmother finally had to be rushed to the ER because her vitals dropped.  Her sodium was at a critical level.  It was so low that she was almost comatose.  The bed sore on her lower back ended up being as big as a softball and 3 inches deep.  She's been sent home with hospice now.  The nursing home has killed my grandmother.

name: Roger Lee The Doodle
text: Some of the staff is very friendly, the other half is very moody.  The weekends are the worst, always short on staff. 1 nurse on staff for 23 patients and meds are late. Cna's barely come to work.  Overall it was close to home, my mom stayed 30 days and I got tired of no improvements, poor food options and understaffed days and weekends so I took her home, couldn't be any worse there.

name: Robert Mcdonald
text: Please Please do not send your loved ones here, so much neglect. You think you are sending them there for doctors and nurses to help them, when all they do is help them to live missorubly and die sooner!!! And that's from my experience and doctors comments at hospital.

name: Sheila Abbott
text: Rude to everyone that lives there  my grandmother thirsts half to death never comes to change her clothes pushes the button and they come two hours later. I usually don’t write reviews but I would want to know if my family would get treated bad. My grandmother is young 55 years old so she’s considered elderly.

name: cool navy
text: I used to stay there the staff did half of the job never again

name: J Pannell
text: I stayed there last year for rehab after being shot for a busted feemer it's the most nasty inhumane place I've ever been my family checked me out

name: Kurt Wilson
text: Treated my family w/ respect

name: Tavouis Adams
text: Birmingham east nursing rehab

name: Mark Lester
text: I WAS A RESIDENT THERE! I WAS just getting over a Serious Sickness situation that made it to where I couldn't hardly walk by Myself for a bit. Prior to going there over in River-View Hospital. Funny thing to add in-advance, I'd got shipped there via Ambulance on Feb.14th ( out all days, lol ). Anyway, River-View had sent me there @ Coosa Valley for Re-Hab. Now, My then-recent foot surgery DIDN'T HELP MATTERS @ ALL ( in the start ). Did PLENTY of Paper-work, & met sev. of The Staff/Workers ( CNA,RN, Physical Re-Hab Personnel, Etc. ). I'd DID MY BEST I Could ( with HELP from The Staff ) to get the Req. Re-Hab needed ASAP! Infact, they'd "Begged" me to stay, but I was ready ( no more need for wheel-chair except, maybe a cain, kept. clean+showered without needed extra help, etc. ). I'd left out of there on March 31 2020. The Physical Department WAS ( THE CROWN-LOYAL ), so to speak! Let me work @ MY OWN Phase, allow Music to help aid the excerises given to each Patient/Resident , & were such a Jolly-Bunch! Now, The CNA's Behaviors varied on Person to Person of how one was treated, or how that one Resident Behaved towards them.

name: Brown Suga
text:
IF YOU VALUE YOUR LIFE DON'T WORK HERE
Short and simple! They don't value the residents or the workers. Durning the pandemic they've withheld material's to help keep down virus AND information from CERTAIN workers!!! They are ALWAYS ill prepared for important things and are usually unaware of what really needs to be brought to attention. This place will throw you to the wolves and watch you get eaten alive and cover it up like it didn't happen. Your life, health and family is more important then making money especially here!!!

name: Sharon Gaddy
text: Have a ex sister in law in here took her husband to visit an for some reason he is not allowed to go past the doors they bring her out to see him,,they are very rude to him an hateful ,,an he's 73 an she's 93 I've had speaker phone on when he calls,,some times they are nice but mostly rude an it's mostly office personal...

name: Patti Neal
text: I can honestly say that they don't care about their employees.  I was a dedicated employee that truly cared for my residents and my residents loved me back. I tried so hard to make sure that my patients were kept clean and comfortable.  I worked overtime when they were short staffed, anytime they needed me. I really cared. I saw good nurses get fired for no reason.  They have no respect for the good people that try to do a good job. They show no loyalty for the staff. This is why the place can't keep good people that try.  This is why they have such a poor score. The nurses are pushed beyond their limits, and they are always short staffed. The residents don't get the proper care they deserve,  because they either push good people away, or they have people who come in to work and end up quitting after being worked to death, getting no loyalty from the administration.  I had high hopes that if I came in worked hard, took excellent care of my patients that it would gain myself a positive impact and I would stay till retirement.  This place is miserable.  Every single day.  I wouldn't have a family member admitted to their facility.  Lots of other great nursing homes in the area to choose from.

name: Darla Newman
text: This place is horrible.  They could care less about your loved one.  They let them lay in a mess for hours at a time.  They loose all of their clothes even if you tell them that you will do their laundry.  If you care about your Loved one do not take them to this place.  It is a joke.  I would not take a stray dog to this place.

name: J. P
text: Great 👍 👍

name: Mike Simonton
text: My wife went in that PLACE the 18 of May .Two weeks later she died i was not contacted till she had passed away and wad flat out lied to.. They did not return her belonging. Will not answer any questions . I would not recommend those people to take care of a dog

name: Sally Ann
text: Staff has a heart for healthcare!  The nursing staff goes above and beyond to make sure the residents have their needs met. Even weekly shopping trips to the grocery store if residents would like to have special items delivered to their homes. It's a home away from home.

name: Lillian Christian
text: I will not recommend this place to anyone. I be put on hold a long time and get no answer. I am not able to communicate with my son .,And I don’t get accurate information about his condition. I am going to report them.

name: Norma Brunson
text: Everyone has been wonderful.   The staff has catered to all my uncles needs.

name: L K
text: Stroke victim made to remain in bed 24/7 with NO rehab. Not turned and checked for excretion or urination for hours and now has a growing bed sore. By law a patient needs to be turned every two hours!!

name: Mizz Lisa Kay Hawkins (Lkay)
text: As A Certified Nursing Assistant Working Here .. I loved this job.. Me Myself and other CNAs treated our Residents with Love and commitment in which we treated them as we wanted our Family to be treated.. Anyways i worked her And Got CNA of the Month By ""Mr George Thoroton " whom i miss dearly.. i miss all my Residents Dearly.  Great Nursing Home. Very Well Strict and Caring .. I worked between the years of August 2007- December 2009

name: Lynda Cook
text: My sister has been there 3 or 4 years .I've never witnessed anything bad happening n my sister loves it

name: Jenna Wyatt
text: Absolutely horrible... Not enough words in the world to describe how horrid this place is. From the ridiculous attitudes and stories that don't add up to the poor people the just leave laying or sitting anywhere with full diapers and all. The state needs to step in and fix this place.

name: Leon Archer
text: Disgusting. Can never find a nurse or a CNA. This place is filthy and stinks all the time of poo.

name: Anita Chandler
text: I’ve been given the opportunity to love and serve numerous patients and residents over the past twelve years. I’m truly blessed. So many positive outcomes and thankfulness from so many and I appreciate all of you for your kind words and support. It has always been my desire to provide the best possible care to everyone that is or was entrusted to our care. Thank you and may God continue to bless you and be near you. Always remember you and your family are in my daily prayers.

resp.text: Hello Anita! We’re so happy to have you as part of the Signature family. We appreciate your dedication and compassion! – Sincerely, Signature HealthCARE

name: Niki Malone
text: The facility has had a turn over in the some of the management team. There is a new Admission Director, Rehab Director, Nutritionist, Social Worker just to name a few. These new shining stars will bring a lot to Whitesburg Gardens. Look forward to the growth potential with these new Managers.

resp.text: Hello Niki and thank you so much for your review! The feedback of our residents, families, and stakeholders is valuable to us. – Sincerely, Signature HealthCARE

name: Zerlinda Armes
text:
This month I am completing my 7th year at Signature Healthcare of Whitesburg Gardens. As the Business Office Manager, it is my pleasure to be a go-to-person to our residents and family.  I assist in navigating the deep sea of Alabama Medicaid for those who need to transition to long term care. I am thorough in helping to address any issues that may hinder Medicaid eligibility.

Since I have been a member of the team, I have enjoyed working with amazing people.  From the nurses and CNAs, to the adminstration, dietary, and housekeeping, these people work.  We have a CEO who believes in urgency, and you don't find that everywhere.  I have grown professionally, personally, and spiritually in my time at Signature Healthcare of Whitesburg Gardens.  We are here to serve.

resp.text: Hello Zerlinda! We’re so happy you joined the Signature family! You are a great team member and we value your dedication and compassion! – Sincerely, Signature HealthCARE

name: Dennis Buck
text: There is no way to give a negative star or I  I would. My mom is a resident there this has to be the worst nursing home in not only the state of Alabama... but possibly anywhere.   As of this post my mom....94 years old....with COPD... congestive heart failure and an A fib pacemaker as a few of her issues was diagnosises Sat 8/29 with COVID 19.  She is luckily finally on her way to the ER as of Monday night about 6 pm.  This is in no thanks to anyone at Whitesburg. The absolute lack of any protocol to make sure someone in her condition is ssen by a PA or doctor is just the tip of the iceberg. During conversation today with the RN of the Covid ward she stated no we can't have her seen by anyone as our process is to give Tylonol if her temp continues to rise. The simple fact that the Covid in this facility is being spread by the staff is the only explanation.  The place has been locked down and no visitors could possibly get in.  The list of issues goes on and on and on.   They will probably remove it but if you want more info, email me at dbuckretired@aol.com.  If you are thinking of this place and can run away....do so...If your family member is a patient here...I will pray for them.....

resp.text: Hello Dennis. Thank you for taking the time to review us, and please know that we value your feedback. We are committed to serving our residents and their families with compassion, dedication, and commitment for the utmost safety of all. If you would like to discuss your concerns further, we would like to hear from you.  Please contact our anonymous CAREline at (888) 392-8886 or via www.ltcrevolution.ethicspoint.com. – Sincerely, Signature HealthCARE

name: Barron Stephens
text: My mother in hear at whites burg gardens.   They take very good care of her and are very kind polite and are making her days nice here.  She came in after heart surgery and will be hear for a long time.  I'm glad they are helping us so much.

resp.text: Barron, It is our pleasure to serve your mother and your family with joy and compassion. Your feedback is important to us, and please know that we value your experience. - Sincerely, Signature HealthCARE of Whitesburg Gardens

name: frances bulliner
text: Called to find a friend, they give me the wrong number and when asked for the right number they hang up and stop answering

resp.text: Hello Frances, we appreciate your concerns and are very sorry to read of your experience. If you would like to discuss this further, please contact our anonymous CAREline at (888) 392-8886 or via www.ltcrevolution.ethicspoint.com. – Sincerely, Signature HealthCARE

name: Sheri Hammond
text: My review is absolutely on nothing at the facility. But I have left numerous emails with my phone number to text or call by email address to email me asking information about your facility. I always get a computer-generated email saying someone will be in touch with me by the next day. I have yet to hear from anyone. I have a mother with Alzheimer's and I need a home for her and I'm actively looking and this is the best fit I think but no one will return any of my messages.

resp.text: Sheri, if you would like to comment or directly email us at admission.whitesburg@signaturehealthcarellc.com with the best phone number to reach you, we will be happy to directly contact you. -Sincerely, Signature HealthCARE

name: Kristen Goode
text: My grandfather spent a few weeks at Whitesburg Gardens for rehab after back surgery. We’re more than pleased with how he was treated, the quality of care, and of course bring allowed to bring our vaccinated family dogs to visit.

resp.text: Hi Kristen. Thank you for your 5 stars and for taking the time to leave us a review. We are so thrilled to hear your great feedback. - Sincerely, Signature HealthCARE

name: Nakesha Lemons
text: I've had the pleasure of working with these folks for about 8 years and I can't think of a better crew. They are truly my family and I admire how passionate they are about caring for our patients. Loving the Whitesburg family!

resp.text: Nakesha, it is a pleasure having you part of the Signature family! Thanks for taking the time to review us! Sincerely - Signature HealthCARE

name: Kurt W
text:
My mother was in the facility for about a month in June 2015. The folks in the rehab department seemed earnest in their effort and my mother actually thought they were very nice. The doctor/nursing aspect is a totally different matter that seems to operate on providing the minimal care and effort.  If you have a loved one at this facility, you need to pay attention to the needs of your family member.  When I noticed fungal growth on my mother's hand, I called it out.  The nurse told me that the doctor determined it to be a callous. They then promised they would apply fungal cream. I left on business for two weeks and when I returned, her entire hand was covered is what appeared as crusted skin and had spread to her other hand and face.  Only after I raised it to their attention did they start to address the situation. I mean no one seems to have noticed it before this?   It turned out to be scabies which means that she required isolation and likely infected other in the facility.

There were a few other matters such as trash on the floor of her room, the fact they couldn't hang up her clothes, and that when they put her on an air mattress, they shoved the other mattress into the bathroom preventing any access to the bathroom.

A few days later, she fell out of bed. Supposedly she slid off of the air mattress.   They sent her to the emergency room for precaution.  Although she sustained no injuries, the hospital kept my mother as she had a bacterial infection causing her white blood count to be extremely high.

The management staff was nice, and the rehab people seemed genuinely engaged.  Some of the nursing staff were conscientious but to ignore a situation that was clearly out of control and in need of medical attention is inexcusable.

name: House of Big John
text: They healed my father and then some. He arrived ill from Pneumonia and was helpless, unable to lift his head. (near death to be truthful) In 90 days he walked out of there healed. I observed the staff many times caring for the patients just as I would want to be treated, with love and care. The rehab staff, the nurses and care takers are all seemingly caring people. My dad didn't care for the meals at times but it goes that way when you don't get to pick what you get for dinner. They always tried to accommodate him and have the kitchen make him something different. The director was a professional and put us at ease in our first visit with her. I would recommend it to your family based upon my experience there.

name: Nancy Ball
text: The CNAs don’t treat the residents with respect.  I heard one tell a resident in a wheelchair to get her big a$$ out of the way.  Several of my relative’s belongings have been stolen and her clothes just disappear.  The place smells awful the majority of the time I’ve visited and they seem to be short staffed on weekends.

resp.text: Nancy, Thank you for bringing these issues to our attention. We strive to make our residents our top priority every day and deliver the highest quality of care available.  Our Careline advisors would like to personally talk with you about your experience, will you share with us the best  way to contact you? You can also contact our Signature Careline advisors directly at (888) 392-8886. Sincerely - Signature HealthCARE of Whitesburg Gardens

name: Kelly Wells
text: Never allow a loved one to go here!  I Called 911 to have my Mother rushed to Huntsville Hospital emergency room today.  Doctors found her seriously malnourished with multiple open wounds, serious bacterial infections, urinary tract infection, and infiltration pneumonia.  They are still doing tests.  I was told by a WG staff member that they run out of critical medical supplies on a regular basis because they can’t pay their bills.  Only the Nursing Director has the key to the Supply Closet.  I checked with the State of Alabama and they have Tax Liens as well. The Department of Justice announced on June 8, 2018 that Signature Healthcare defrauded Medicare and Medicaid of $244M and were only able to pay back $30M.  Dr Michael K Johnson is the Medical Director and the only Doctor for 159 residents.  My mother has lived there 5 years and I’ve only seen him in the building once.  He doesn’t show up for rounds and operates his own Medical Practice at another location in addition to being the Medical Director for North Alabama Hospice who the Nursing Hope Recommends to patients who don’t quakify for it!!

resp.text: Kelly, Thank you for reaching out.  We have received and responded to the many inquiries you’ve recently sent us.  If there are additional or new concerns, please contact the specific persons at the phone numbers we provided to you.  Our team is happy to personally discuss your experience. Sincerely - Signature HealthCARE of Whitesburg Gardens

name: Lynn Sanders
text:
My mother'n law has been in the care of the wonderful staff at Whitesburg  Gardens for the past two weeks.  From day one I have been impressed and amazed at the level of care she has received.  Mary is 90 years old and in very good health.  Up until her fall, on November 7, 2013, she and her 93 year old husband had been living in their home with the help of a care giver who was with them during the day. ( 8 a.m. - 4 p.m. )  On the evening of Nov. 7th Mary fell and broke her pelvis.  Her GP doctor put her on pain meds and sent her home.  We arranged for 24/7 care for her at home, but within a week after her fall she became listless and stopped eating, sleeping and dehydration was setting in.  An ambulance ride to Crestwood Hospital ER was arranged & she was admitted for 3 days/nights of intensive care to bring her pain under control & getting her back to eating and sleeping normally again.  The admitting Dr. recommended The Kindred Transitional Care & Rehabilitation Center quite highly.

From the first moment I walked into Whitesburg Gardens until this evening, two weeks later, I have felt completely at peace with our decision to have Mary under the care of the caring folks at this rehabilitation facility.  The atmosphere is so positive, and the entire staff works together as a team so completely, that any worry I might have had when Mary was placed in this rehab center has completely vanished.  I've observed a delightful group of caring people who are truly committed to the rehabilitation & attaining the goal of giving their patients their lives back, no matter what age or disability they have upon their admittance to the facility.

During the course of these past two weeks at Whitesburg Gardens, I have had an education in true compassion, a deliciously keen sense of humor expressed by the majority of the staff and a depth of dignity shown to the men and women who are going through a positive rehabilitation while on their journey back to living the lives they want to live.

Kudos all around!

I wish to express my sincere thanks to everyone who works at Whitesburg Gardens.

Lynn Sanders

name: Angela Glaze
text: I give one star because you can't post without giving something. I wish I could give some type of notice to close down this facility and relocate the residents that are stuck there... to some this is as close to a death sentence as possible. The best recommendation I can give anyone is to not consider this facility to provide the care for a loved one. Moving my mother to another facility was the best thing we could do for her. Diversicare of Riverchase left much to be desired. The lack of compassion and the poor communication are two of the things they should be known for. Their admin leads most of the group that treat you in a very disrespectful and unprofessional manner. If you disagree with what she has to say she will quickly threaten to write up a 30 day discharge notice for your loved one. They recently upgraded their phone system which gives you false hope of being able to get someone on the phone and have your issues resolved. Most people do not return your calls unless you have to escalate your concern by emailing or calling the number on the website. I will say that there are a couple of staff members that did assist my family, and those ladies are Vicky and Lauren. If you send your loved one here please do not send any belongings that you would not want lost or given to another resident. My mother was sent to Diversicare from a short term facility with notes from her husband (who suddenly passed away while she was in rehab). A staff member hung one of the notes on her wall and at some point it was lost and never located. In addition to a note that they placed on her wall being lost, a note inside of my mothers glasses case was lost, a cell phone was lost twice, phone chargers were lost, numerous pieces of her laundry were lost, a hard back photo book with her name and photo on the cover was lost. We were offered a reimbursement on a cell phone and book but no one ever got back with us to issue reimbursement. The most important thing they lost was MY MOTHER - she was supposed to go to the ER and I called to see which one she went to. The two staff members who had me on speaker phone were disagreeing with one another about if she was sent out or not. One finally said "I know she went out but I can't tell you where". 32 minutes later I had to call them back to see if they found where she was. 7 minutes of being hold I was told that she either never was sent out or already returned. No one could clearly tell me what the true story was. For an hour or more they were not even aware that she was in their facility! At one point a photo blanket of my mother with her family was lost and then found and kept in the admins office for weeks. Upon picking up some of our mothers belongings we found dirty laundry with another woman's name in it in a bag with trash, some purses and wallets that were not our mother's, etc. As our mother made it to the new facility we found that the new clothing items we took to her a couple of months prior were not sent with her. We saw our mother at doctor appointments and through zoom calls and she was wearing clothes that were not hers. I would do your loved one a favor and find any other place other than this one to send them to. REMEMBER YOU ARE THE ADVOCATE FOR YOUR LOVED ONE AND YOUR VOICE IS STRONGER THAN SOME OF THE PEOPLE IN THESE CARE FACILITIES. This is only a highlight of the ridiculous things my mother and family endured from late June 2020 through late February 2021.

It breaks my heart to see how badly the residents are treated and how run down and disgusting the facility is.

name: O. Shanta
text:
I chose this place for my mom because the pictures looked pretty and cleaned, plus the offered rehabilitation. My lack of knowledge caused my mother a lot of neglect and humiliation. There is a ton I could say but I’m going to narrow it down to four:
1. My mom called me one day around 730pm and stated she had been calling for someone to come change her diaper since 3:30pm.
2. My mom suffers from CHF and needs a low sodium diet. Whatever she would chose from her REGULAR menu to eat, the kitchen would send her whatever they wanted her to have. Usually something processed and high in salt. Now my mother retains fluid very badly.
3. After seeing other areas of neglect, I researched better facilities and put in to transfer my mother. I put the request in, in person on a Thursday morning. I came back Friday afternoon and it had not been send. I checked on it Monday evening it was finally sent. Then there was the transportation issue, the family pays, WHAT no one told me. Well Magnolia social services didn’t help me, nor did they offer guidance or contact numbers. So I called the transfer NEW facility and admissions said “we will take care of this for you and we will get you the lowest price possible, we will try to make this transition smooth”. About 15 Min later I was set with transportation.
4. They are always short staff, once my mother had a very bad case of heart burn. She pushed her button for help, a hour later mom called me and I called the nurses  desk. The supervisor came, took her BP, said she will be back with some tums. An hour later Mom pushed the button. No one came. She called me, I called the desk, the new shift nurse said the supervisor WENT HOME! So I got dress and went to the store and drove from the South side to Gardendale to take mom some heartburn meds.

When you enter Magnolia Ridge the smell of OLD urine and bowels will meet you at the door and it lingers in the hallways. Whenever I leave the building that smell is stuck to my clothes.

If you put your love ones in this facility “YOU BETTA CHECK ON THEM DAILY”

name: Michael Schmidt
text: My Mom was a resident of memory care at The Blake for several years before her passing  in July 2020. Though initially it was tough transitioning her from her home to a care facility (she was a strong-willed even WITH  dementia!), she adjusted thanks to the love and care she received. I never regretted my decision. Kudos the Director John Michael, the management team and the entire group of caregivers. I never worried about Mom's safety or well-being while she lived at The Blake. Thank you for making her part of the family and for my peace-of-mind!

resp.text: Michael, thank you so much for leaving this wonderful review and sharing your experience with our community. It was such an honor and privilege to have your mother as one of our residents and as part of the family here. We will pass along your kind words to our team, and always feel free to reach out if you need anything in the future. Take care!

name: Claudia Daniel
text:
Our mom arrived at the Blake at Malbis pretty much kicking and screaming. Much different story now, she is happy,  calm,  and grateful that she doesn’t have to worry about her house upkeep anymore.
Her major adjustment took about 3 to 4 weeks.
John Micheal, the executive director is almost always able to talk when I have a question, so is the rest of the staff, they have all been so helpful and kind.
Bonnie and the other ladies who answer the phone are knowledgeable, helpful and friendly.
The nursing staff are the best by far, I consider them like friends and so does my wonderful mom.
Mom loves the food and keeps saying her pants are to tight now!
The activities director, Petra, always has something going on, right now she is putting together a grandparents day treat for the residents.
John Michael has kept the family current with all updates about the COVID-19. The Blake is very cautious about opening up to soon, for this I’m extremely grateful. It’s a horrible way for any loved one to pass. They have in my opinion gone out of there way to try ways for us to see our mom.
I chose The Blake for our mom 1 year ago because it felt like a home when I went on my first tour. My opinion has not changed.
We dreaded putting mom in a home, but we have been so happy, and so has she, because she is in a place that is like a home.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your experience with our community, Claudia! Your mother is a joy to have as our resident and we most certainly appreciate your involvement as well. We're always striving to provide the best care possible for our residents and reviews like this are so great to see. We will definitely be passing along your kind words to our team.

name: Jason Smith
text: Our family had a terrible experience. I find the facility unfit to care for the elderly.

resp.text:
Hi Jason,
We want to take the chance to apologize for the negative experience you've had with our community. We'd really like to know more about your situation in order for us to improve. Please reach out to  Executive Director, Tammy Robinson, at tammy.robinson@blakeliving.com to discuss matters further.

name: Janet Norman
text: My mom suffered from dementia and short term memory loss and I tried having her live with me.  It was clear I could not provide her the care she needed.  The staff at The Blake - Malbis (memory care) loved and cared for my mother like I never expected.  Mom went on outings, participated in activities.  I visited her all times of the day throughout the week and found her well cared for and engaged in activities.  Turning over your parent to others for care is a very difficult decision but at The Blake - Malbis she was under the best care you could ask for.  The staff made a very difficult situation much easier for me and my brother.  Mom was better looked after than I was capable of doing.  Thank you everybody, especially John, Petra, and Rachel.

resp.text: Janet, we really appreciate you leaving this thoughtful review on our community. It truly means a lot to us, and we'll make sure to pass your review on for our staff to see. Taking the best possible care of our residents and offering support to family members are our top priorities, and reviews like yours reassure us we're on the correct path.

name: Rhonda Winder
text:
While our family has an overall great impression with The Blake at Malbis, we do have an experience with them that isn’t so great. They can very easily rectify matters, but so far they refuse to do so. It has to do with the beauty salon.
If you’re loved one wishes to get their hair done they may make use of the in-house salon. There is a form that the person responsible to pay the salon charges fills out. You may leave a credit card on file and you may opt to just have your card used whenever the resident wishes or be asked if you’re in agreement with your family member having their hair done before being charged. This is so that a family member who is losing their mental acuity doesn’t decide to go get their hair done too often, which was our situation, and we stipulated on the form that we’d like to be contacted first.
However, our card was charged several times with no permission request beforehand. To the tune of approximately $500.00. With our busy life we didn’t catch these charges as they were incurred. Once we did see them, we called and got them stopped.  To their credit, The Blake admitted they were in the wrong. However, it has been over a year of requesting the fraudulent charges be reversed or having a check sent to us. We’ve been in touch with the beauty salon, patient representatives, the facility manager and a regional manager. We’ve allowed each person along the way ample time to make it right, sometimes two months before we call again, but no resolution is ever forthcoming. Now, they’ve stopped taking our calls.
We will now pursue this with our credit card company.
Our family member passed away in May of 2020, so they are no longer a resident. I would hate to think that is the reason we now are not even getting our phone calls answered.
If you’re wondering why our family member passed away, it was due to the virus. We were told she was the only one in the whole facility to contract it. A subsequent email from The Blake that was emailed to families of the residents claimed to have zero cases of the virus at The Blake.
I suppose no place can be 100% above board at all times, but these things concern us.
Please don’t misunderstand us. We realize the virus is strange and can effect some and not others. We have no ill feelings in that regard. These things happen. But we would love to be treated as well as we were when she was accepted there.
We have no other complaints. The facility was a beautiful and very nice place for seniors.

resp.text:
Hi Rhonda,
First and foremost, we want to apologize that you've had this unpleasant experience. During this unprecedented time, we have made, and continue to make, it a priority to keep our residents and families as up-to-date as possible with the most accurate and timely information available to us. Additionally, we strive to partner with the best service providers in order to give our residents the highest quality services and amenities possible. We understand you have had a frustrating experience working with our previous stylist provider and we are currently working hard to reach a solution for you. We are grateful to have had the opportunity to care for your mother and we want to thank you for your trust and kind words regarding the care she received as a resident here at The Blake.

name: D Joiner
text:
I have never written an online review, but the experience we had with this facility warrants my remarks. My mother was a Memory Care resident for 2 months 25 days before removing her from this facility.  Once home she was examined by our physician along with labs received from the Blake.  She had lost approximately 20 lbs, was poorly nourished (per lab work), had a large pressure ulcer on hip (never reported by staff), cellulitis in lower extremity (never reported by staff or wasn’t being treated).  She walked in on admission and was wheelchair bound upon leaving. As I said that is the SHORT LIST of issues we had with this facility.  Don’t be fooled by the
“nice facility or friendly staff”.  My mother was neglected physically and medically.  I am not just a disgruntled daughter. I worked in critical care for years, served as nurse manager of a critical care unit and a cardiology outpatient clinic.  I know poor care when I see it!!!

resp.text:
Hi D,
We apologize that you’ve had a negative experience with our community. At The Blake, we're committed to offering the best care possible for residents, as well as support for family members. Although it’s never easy to receive reviews like these, we take them very seriously and we'd like to resolve any issues you've had with our level of care. If you'd like to discuss these matters further, please contact our Executive Director, John Michael, at john.michael@blakeliving.com.

name: Sam Adams
text: Our only problem with The Blake, is information, few of the staff will give out info. In particular our Dad,(93 yrs.) was admitted during covid 19 and quarantined until negative test result, we were told 2 days to get result, after 5 days we questioned why no result, after a full fay and multiple calls we were then told 3 days in quarantine before test is even performed. Not veryhvery

resp.text:
Hello Sam,
We sincerely apologize for your frustrating experience; we know how stressful a delay in receiving information can be, especially in times like these. Also we want to thank you for your support and patience as we navigate through these unprecedented challenges.  We would like to reach out to see how can better improve this process, so this isn't repeated in the future. Please contact us at (251) 625-6400, so we can discuss this matter further.

name: Brad Hinman
text: My Mom has been in several assisted living facilities over the years and this is the best! Highly recommend...

name: Susan Holmes
text: My Dad lasted a total of 45 hours in their Memory Care facility. During that time he fell 3 times. They said he was physically aggressive and called an ambulance to take him to the hospital. They only way we knew this was - the hospital called for information.  If he became angry, and he might have, it was because he was scared!  However, 2 hours later when the ambulance did arrive, he was asleep in his chair.  He is now in the hospital with pneumonia.  These residents are not safe! Oh! ...and I had left him a gift bag with a variety of items the first day.  We never found it!

resp.text:
Hello Susan-
We would like to sincerely apologize for your experience at our beloved community. As resident care and employee support are our top priorities at the Blake, we take these comments very seriously. John Michael, our Executive Director, would love to speak with you further about your experience. Please call (251) 625-6400 to reach him. Again we appreciate your comments and apologize for the negative experience.

name: Natalie Davis
text: Prior to working at The Blake, I worked WITH The Blake. They truly care about the residents and their families. It is a beautiful community, the food is great, and it is a fun place to be. I would most definitely place my family here when the time comes.

name: Jerre Brisky
text: Wonderful and gorgeous facility.

name: Crooked Smile
text: Great
